FTJlQr8ypLLMfc3s2n0SQQ.text: Nice old environment, really has the oldies them going on. Kind of in weird location on 7th st, not what I expected.  With the choice of 99 syrup flavors, it can be overwhelming when deciding however the soda drink was good.  I had the chicken/bacon wrap and was horribly sick(bathroom wise) within two hours so cannot vouch for the food quality and might stick to ice cream only next time

u3isyovrgsdUzqJ_B39mXw.text: Yum! Try one of everything! So so good! Their burgers are delicious,  yummy potato salad.  Their vintage shop is amazing! Fair prices. Customer service is super friendly. I live in san diego California and drive out to Phoenix just for this gem.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pure awesomeness

wj2aE45RgohMqT3AFEyJsA.text: Vintage! It feels like your in prohibition era Chicago. Definitely come for the experience and Soda made in house.

Km8b9-jbDv_QkE_p2ViRew.text: A hidden gem. I was surprised to find an antique shop that you have to walk through to get to diner. The atmosphere was very welcoming. The waitress Amanda was a 5 star and represented her company very well. I ordered the egg salad sandwich and couldn't decide on my side when she ask if she could recommend one. My wife ordered the bogart which was a huge roast beef sandwich and side of slaw. The bread on both sandwiches was the best we've ever had. We will be back and bring friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg salad sandwich
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bogart

DG5SZ2e2jvIyMvwUJtWHfg.text: Definitely worth checking out if you like ice cream, and who doesn't?! The banana split was ah-mazing! We actually went for lunch, and the regular food was nothing special. All the ice cream and soda options made up for that, as did the atmosphere. Very vintage. Don't know if I'd go back for food, but I'll definitely be returning for something sweet!

HMgKwhPDWtJ4agxqVx6weg.text: This place is great! I took the kids here after a day at the Phoenix Children's Museum and got some ice cream. My son had a Coke float, daughter had a scopp of ice cream and I had a hot fudge sundae. Holly hell, that hot fudge sundae was as big as my head! And I loved EVERY bit of it. You walk through an antique room to get to the restaurant and then there is a vintage/antique store  connected on the other side, too. After the ice cream, we wandered around and looked at all of the cool stuff for it. Unfortunately, my four year old is like an elephant in a china store, so I couldn't exactly relax.   The next day, I came back and picked up some reasonably priced vintage/thrift store dresses around $20 a piece. The black dress was perfect for a 20's party I attended and the second dress was a long sleeved, low cut, long red dress with yellow flowers that I am wearing today for a Halloween party.   Ice cream and antiques are the way to spend the day!

EcYqgTbl0wAJqK2gNgJJnQ.text: Overpriced,  Other than that the place is fun and the service is friendly. The food was ok, nothing special. The soda & ice cream were good, but again overpriced. I can't see myself ever coming back.

_zyWt46lJLsVUX0lXwNO7w.text: Such a cute store and restaurant. The food is beyond fabulous. Amazing sodas and ice cream too. :) We love this place.

QnrKxRUlOmg5WnAZ2AGsOg.text: So when I first wakled into MacAlpine's {the restaurant part} I felt like I was walking into the 1955 diner from Back to the Future. Very awesome soda bar, with about every flavor of soda known to man. I quickly ordered a strawberry-banana soda and looked at the menu. For the most part it's a very simple menu, they obviously don't have fryers so the sides are kind of lame {bagged potato chips, really?} but I was not disappointed in the hamburger I got! Mmmmmmm! So delicious! Real cheese, a nice meaty taste and the bun seriously melted in my mouth - dare I say freshly baked?   Now for the dessert! We got the turtle sundae and it was amazing!! The portion size will not disappoint, and the ice cream had the perfect texture and consistency.   Really loved my first visit to MacAlpine's and I will definitely be going back for round two and three and four and...

NDJ-rV7F-cCihJfaVbXNyg.text: This is a cute, fun little place to eat or get a treat. BUT it's very expensive for the low quality of food. The ice cream is cheap, bottom of the barrel stuff they sell at water and ice. The staff wasn't very friendly either. Great for tourists  but not for families or students on a budget

quYv7MkS4FmdCCkVzqbMFw.text: Pleasantly Surprised!!!   After reading so many bad reviews about service, I was ready for some pretty crappy service. I was pleasantly surprised how the staff was friendly, attentive and quick with service. Since so many raved about the potato salad we decided to at least sample a side of it even though we were just there for dessert. It was really good and we wished for a huge bowl of it after. We had the Turtle Sundae, Rootbeer Shake and a Coffee/Caramel Shake. All three desserts were tasty and we can't wait to come back and try other variations.

Bn_RknzqXcoo30FiQCX3Xg.text: really cool place great selection of ice cream soda's the food was ok but you come here for the ice cream treats they even had hot chocolate for my almost son-in-law he's a little bit crazy. Its connected to a vintage store that you can check out after your cool treats, I will surely be coming back for more ice cream

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork BBQ pork sandwich and Bettie Page soda and Parisian soda
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot chocolate and they still serve being 115 degrees outside!

qdDjWz5gxdc-SfOYzzMoHg.text: We LOVE this place. Great sandwiches, AMAZING  ice cream sundaes, sodas,and shakes. The ambiance is really wonderful. Old-time soda shop and store. We come here and often and will continue to do so. Make sure you check all the crazy flavors they have for ice cream sodas.

7rp3qr1UiSJ9zEC65oVuaw.text: Wow, what a great piece of history. Wayne Newton was a patron as a kid and discovered right in this soda fountain joint. Root beer floats are the best. We are hooked and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soda fountain wall with antique goodies.

F2z1e6z9Baygy73aPFXY5g.text: Adorable. Really, so cute. The wait staff does their best to pull off the retro vibe, red lips and high ponytails.  The soda counter is covered in flavored syrups, any flavor you could dream of they have. Came in to split a banana split with my hubby, I know right?  Gross. This place does that to you though.  It all whip cream and cherries and "isn't that bobby so cute". The split was good, the price was fair, and it was a fun little time traveling experience.

vwtAJ0x-hpjpD6XyyMM1Uw.text: A wonderful soda/ice cream bar! From the old-fashion decor to the top-notch selections to the wonderful waitress! I love ice cream immensely, but I swear our waitress loved ice cream as much as I do. And that's certainly a plus! It's always great to know your server can honestly recommend you great items on the menu because they love it as much as you do.  As for what we ordered: The King Kong, Beerbutter, and Lucky Leprechaun. The King Kong? Really good. Beerbutter? Also really good. Mixed together? MAGIC. Stick two straws in your mouth and have at it! The Lucky Leprechaun was also wonderful - but admittedly, I was never a fan of mint ice creams... despite that, I still drank this lovely float and enjoyed it wonderfully~ I can't say for sure how it tasted when mixed with BOTH the King Kong and Beer Butter, mostly because by then my stomach, tongue, and throat had been sweetened to the point of no return. I also ordered a Yin & Yang on the side as my main meal (Did I mention that I *love* ice cream?), which was absolutely delicious. And my partner ordered a sloppy joe, which was surprisingly sweet! That was also delicious.  I will say, as someone who's eaten tons of ice cream from various restaurants, bars, stores, and hole-in-the-walls: Their ice cream quality isn't perfectly amazing. Their toppings and syrups aren't top-notch. As I'm not a soda-expert, I can't account for the quality of the sodas. What makes this place earn five stars, however, is the overall, combined experience.  The flavor choices, with their fun names and creative combinations... The customizations you can add that seem infinite... The warm, homey environment... The interesting bits and bobs to stare at... And the smiling service...? All added up to an unforgettable experience.  I wish I lived in the area so I could come here again and again. Those of you lucky enough to be in the area: Go in and try it out!

VcR_q-hL4GBy955GtcCiSg.text: One of the most charming and unique spots in town! Its only real competitor might be 5 & Diner, but the beauty of MacAlpine's is that it is a genuine, original soda fountain, operating for over 70 years. This place is the real deal, and we're so happy it is still here in Phoenix after all these years.  You can't beat the selection and quality of ice cream sodas, malts, floats, sundaes - even the unusual egg creams and phosphates! You've gotta try one once, just for the experience. The food is quite good - our favorite menu item is the hot pastrami on rye, which comes with a pickle and a side of potato chips or some very good coleslaw. This pastrami is one of my favorite versions of the sandwich in town, I prefer it even over Miracle Mile Deli and Chompie's, which are both excellent.  The adjoining antique shops are small but cool and always have interesting new goodies and vintage clothing.

Wvnety00uRCq_TYD6OPUww.text: Ambiance gets 5 stars - it was like stepping back into a different decade of the past, maybe 1940's? If you are a fan of authentic vintage nostalgic things, you'll love this place.  The counter, flooring, and tables/booths looked to have been around for decades and I really appreciate how it was not torn out and updated, something rare to find these days in the Valley.  Milkshake was pretty good. It was just under $4.  Soup was homemade and not too bad. $1.95 for a cup. I didn't try their other food. Chips come with burgers, no fries.  Service gets 2 stars - UGH! They do their best to avoid eye contact and never clear away the dirty dishes. I don't think the Food Servers have assigned tables, so they really aren't very attentive. I almost felt like getting up and making my own milkshake, because no one was around.  I worked as a Food Server in my college days and if I were them, I'd be taking every customer that came in the door, get customers in and out quickly = more tips. These young gals just didn't seem to care. Sad.  The antique shop attached to the restaurant was on the pricey side, but looked like a mini department store of the past with a nice selection of vintage clothing. Fun to look, esp being in the old building made it more authentic.

1XBSaZMTXOt9BibJJyfoHQ.text: I love this place! Priced right, great food and the ambiance is so unique. I love taking out of town visitors here. On top of that, it is fun to walk around looking at the antiques - it's not just food but an experience!

2m1lhLZKhZ8SapmRpmPbJQ.text: Macaplines.. Go here for nostalgia, and a swell soda, float, or sundae. *Don't* go here for food. I've been to this place several times, I really enjoy the deserts and sodas. I've ordered food here a few times, and it just tastes so blah. I would really love it if they bought local and had more "live" food options. Everything just tastes "dead" and flavor less. The tomatoes and other veggies that I had were green and as tasteless as anything I'd get at a fast food joint. There are *very* limited vegetarian options, and maybe 1? vegan option.  They have a neat shop for clothing, jewlery, furniture, and bric a brac from days gone by. Sometimes I just stop by the shop.

sCRts4TWBpA9I7yGeRW7bA.text: Quirky atmosphere, super friendly and cheerful staff, AMAZING prices, and my very first soda phosphate experience. Been here a few times and excited to take friends soon. Just a really great, casual experience. The food is not outstanding, but everything else MORE than makes up for it. Definitely a must-try! It's just a great place to linger and browse, which seems weird for a restaurant, but it's enjoyable.

zp2ONXVWvR5R-f7ic8dwXQ.text: I have visited MacAlpine's a few times, and every time I have been very pleased with both the food and the service.  The wait staff and the owners are always very friendly and helpful and the food, although nothing fancy, is always good.  I love the atmosphere of this restaurant as well as the neighboring thrift shop that is fun to browse while the food cooks.  And the egg cream sodas are delicious!  Not to mention visiting a piece of Phoenix history at the same time - I love it!  The only downside to this place? I wish they were open later into the evening...

SUoEORIbQ0BFoVqgLYv1Bg.text: Very friendly staff and kitchy decor. Really great soda fountain. Best egg cream I've had in a very long time. Food is straight forward and unpretentious. Very tasty. Good value.

oljGJiANpi2WFm50cc8J3w.text: Go here for the drinks, atmosphere and history.  Their food is okay, but nothing special.  Split a sundae with your honey on a hot afternoon and you'll be hooked.

xiUYZUV8mkNaZzOzpRxKEg.text: You can't beat the atmosphere at this place. I bought a google offer for here a while ago and stopped in on a Sunday afternoon. There were some people inside but it wasn't too crowded. I started in the antique shop wandering around and then made it into the restaurant. I had an ice-cream soda and it was divine. Next time I'd probably split one as the drinks are large. I didn't eat anything but the food looked yummy. I also wandered to the vintage shop next door. It was fun looking around and reminscing.

eJ7ktXAkfMap3UyMQSWOTQ.text: Went with my grandkids.  Food was terrible.  They should just stick to ice cream.  My granddaughter ordered a grill cheese, it was awful.  Velveeta.  She smelled it and said, "This is not cheese." and she was right. The cheese-like food stuck on her teeth and I had to use a napkin to scrap it off.   I order a cheeseburger.  The bun was stale and smashed and the potato salad had no flavor, I think it was store bought. Pickles were good.  I asked for fries, only to be told that they don't have any.  Plus, the owners were off in a corner taking photos to post on Ebay or whatever and a huge flash would go off and everyone in the place seemed annoyed, but they didn't care.  Place was dirty...very dirty, dingy and well, I spent $40-some dollars on garbage. We left and I took the kids to Coco's down the street because we were all still hungry.  We left all of our food.   If you want ice cream, go.  Pass on the food.

MDTJK0mH5Xc14aCwNuMg7Q.text: This place makes me feel like I've just gone back in time! Its right in my neighborhood and so convenient to just walk or ride my bike over. The staff is so nice and personable, and I always enjoy looking at all the antiques while I wait for my food or ice cream. I would recommend it to anyone.

oD6m4kEoHpClrCPSgBEH_A.text: I love this place ! so much atmosphere and history! The ice cream is really yummy too .

8GgjopxQGexbTusYZ5bfUg.text: Pretty darn good - Phoenix's only True throwback 1920's-style soda fountain. Get a load of those green light fixtures down the center of the eating area! Great egg salad sandwiches, blt's, cheeseburgers that are" real" - interesting soups and specials. Potato salad is yumolicious. Shakes and sodas done anyway you like, couldn't be better.  Also an antique emporium and a bit of a historical site, in a minor way - I'll let you find out why. Highly recommend. Wonderful service, very modest prices.

PsbSJPxYAMisfWoFS_Sc8w.text: This is a super cute restaurant with a simple yet delicious menu. They stick to basics which I love. They also have a vintage items that you can admire and purchase. Its a great place if you want a quick, simple, cheap yet delicious meal. Their shakes are amazing as well as their potato salad. YUM! If you are in the area, check it our for sure!

MOi0X0SqXcUgOBNlAo-6sQ.text: Lovely service.  Good food.  Love the incorporation of the antique shop.  Made for a wonderful date night and we'll go back again.

8Izoc3w7ZOFXrhg-mPvmsw.text: Great ambiance and a million soda flavors to choose from. Their vintage furnishings & clothes are in great condition!

ieR0yLEEuMpzvbaTjm4Rkg.text: Went here for a quick bite with family before a play at Phoenix Theater.  I was hesitant based on the reviews here about cleanliness and mediocre food, but the place is a local legend and we had to give it a try.  On the way to our booth, we passed a large empty table that still had the messy remains of previous diners and wondered why the not-busy-at-all waitstaff hadn't cleaned it up yet. The food was on the high side of "just OK."  The malt, ice-cream soda, and phosphates we ordered with dinner were fantastic.  But, before the final curtain of the show, the cramping began for what would be a 24-hour bout of food poisoning traced back - by process of elimination - to McAlpines chicken salad.  I suppose if you want a delicious soda fountain treat, this is your place.  If you want to eat diner food without getting sick, go somewhere else.

ztfZkAJWVLxmLttau6PBew.text: So, I'm speaking of the vintage store attached to the soda fountain area.  I've been shopping for a vintage wedding dress. I was referred here from another vintage store (Mistys). I didnt even know they had a vintage clothing store in back!  I went in thinking I would just turn around and leave. However, I was lead to a back room where they had a few wedding dresses on a rack. I started looking through them and came across the most beautiful ivory, lace bodice with a tule ballroom gown dotted with lace daisies and a detachable LONG daisy adorned tule train.  With a few updates and some modification this dress is the most beautiful dress I have ever seen. I said YES tho the dress at MacAlpines!!!!!  Who would of ever thought I would find my dress here? The girls at the soda fountain were so helpful and super fun! They then proceeded to make me a wedding cake soda! SO GOOD!!! It was the best and most fun unexpected wedding dress buying experience I could've ever hoped for. This is a memory that will last forever....thank you girls!!! You are the best!!! I will send you a wedding picture for sure!

fmt832MfqEO6mYYo8Shpow.text: This place is super cute lunch joint.  I had the sloppy joe special and it reminded me of a home cooked meal back in the day.  I ended my meal with a classic vanilla milkshake which was superb.  Oh yeah!  if you're in a hurry for a quick good sit down lunch, this place is it.  our food came out SO fast.  I will be returning shortly.  You also MUST check out the vintage clothing/ furniture in the room next door before you leave !

mRu4Afa-PpkXsl5_4clfwQ.text: It's hard to top a place with 50+ soda/phosphate/shake flavors and can also put together a perfect pastrami on rye.  One of the experiences in Phoenix.  Finish your meal and buy some antiques when you're done.

di87PvIyAcvaVBGWGcpRHw.text: It was 10:45 Saturday morning and I wanted coffee. I knew of a place right down the street from me and to my disappointment it was closed! WTF! Any way I went searching for a cafe. I wanted to sit down and read the new times with a cup of coffee. I actually started my journey thinking I would stop at the drip. But when i got there that place just seemed to modern for me. I was in a funky mood and just wanted a nice cup of coffee, nothing fancy. So I saw an older man waving a sign that said "Best lunch in town!" and he was kind of dancing too! And I said to myself "Yes, i think I will". So I stumbled upon MacAlpines. They had just opened and I sat right down at the counter. I had two cups of yummy diner coffee and after realizing I was hungry too, I ordered a stuffed tomato that was oh so yummy with super fresh veggies. The decor was adorable and welcoming and I loved the juke box. 25 cents gets you two plays! anyway, I'm not giving it four stars because it took some time for the staff to warm up and be friendly. I don't know if it was just because they had just opened or if it was because I was still sleeping and needed a caffeine fix badly. But I want to go again, with company, not by myself and I'll rate it again.

Mh4uhb9E2_3L4I6ZQvF53Q.text: My wife and I were only in Phoenix for three days and we ended up at MacAlpine's twice. It was that good. The shakes were great, the sandwiches (hot and cold) were great, the potato salad was great one day, but so-so the next. The music was right, the decor was right. The waitresses were prompt and friendly. The soda jerk even wears a paper hat!

dm6DNVF8ZyDO5NtNCq7-Cw.text: Such a great family place!  Very cozy!  The service is great and the ice cream sodas amazing!   I can't wait to go back!

DTI5cB6venBYo-HjonKWmQ.text: According to the menu this place has been in existence since 1929 and it looks like it hasn't missed a beat. The place started out as a pharmacy/ market and now it is a diner/ antique shop. The menu is pretty short, sandwiches and a few blue plate specials.  I ended up getting the malibu chicken sandwich. It was good but a little dry. My wife got the meatloaf, that was good. My son got a fluffer nutter (peanut butter and marsh-mellow cream).  Let's face it, what you really come here for is the dessert. The ice cream sodas are pretty cool. Overall the price is a little bit higher than what I would expect but you have to pay a bit sometimes for ambience.  Service was good. The waitresses were fast and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gN3tqQePC2b_5Ij3BoGdQg.text: Finding MacAlpine's is fairly simple as it's located on the corner of 7th and E. Oak. There's a small parking lot on the side of the building off of Oak st. When you first walk in you might think to yourself, "Whoa, this place serves food?" And yes, my friend they certainly do. Once you get passed the trinkets and other items you'll find an original old fashioned soda bar, several booths, and dining tables. The decor is a cluttered arrangement of vintage 1920's and 30's memorabilia.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with answering my questions about the many creative ice cream soda creations available. They use hand scooped ice cream and flavored sodas created the same way it was in the late 1920's. I have to admit it made for one of the, if not the best, ice cream sodas I've ever had. Yes, it was really that good.   For my menu choice I opted for the chef's special that day which happened to be a meatloaf sandwich. Served on toasted wheat bread, with fresh tomato, lettuce and a slight bit of mayo. The meatloaf itself was packed full of flavor. Although a little softer in texture than I usually prefer, I couldn't stop eating until my plate was clean. Even though I ordered a side of coleslaw and got potato salad instead. I was truly not disappointed. The potato salad was to die for. I wish I could order more and have it shipped home.   If you've made it this far in my review, give yourself a treat and head to MacAlpines. There's a 10 lb sundae called 'The Legend' waiting for your challenge.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3HLKioJ0yZHz4wnWlE5sNg.text: If your in Phoenix you have to come here. Incredible atmosphere and killer food. So many flavored of shakes, sodas and freezes it baffles the mind. Real home made burgers and good cole slaw that's not to sweet or too tart.   But seriously back to the shakes and freezes. I had a Chocolate Root Beer shake with my burger and after dinner a black cherry freeze. Both great!  The crew here was wonderful. Very friendly and it felt like I was a regular on my first visit  There is also a complete antique shop to look over. I am coming back anytime I am in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great crew and look at all those bottles of flavor!
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great burgers and shakes

Mtf305YT6Z5iBfTZswKmmw.text: This place is so cute. The food is decent and the soda bar is awesome. You can look at the antique shop while you wait for your food. Very fun place.

FEdbpW9tnYkWJeUcUVrkZA.text: So glad we decided to come here. My grandmother recommended this restaurant and told me her mom used to come here after school for ice cream. It feels like the atmosphere couldn't have changed much at all since my great grandma used to come here. I had a chili burger and vanilla shake. They were out of pecan pie so I wasn't able to try that, but overall it was great food with a fun environment. Hardly any wait at all for our food.

vwyhei9wMzjr0-X2UgLFFg.text: I have been coming to MacAlpine's for about 10 years, maybe more. I go with my girlfriends for a fun lunch, I go with my husband and we take out of town guests here. The antiques are great, the people are great and the food is so comforting.  This most recent visit my friend and I ordered a Reuben and Sloppy Joe and each had half of the other's sandwich. It's all so good we couldn't decide! I also had a praline soda. That decision took me forever because they have so many fun flavors to choose from.  My sandwich was perfect - and I am from New York. I know Reubens! The Sloppy Joe was tasty and just a little sweet. I love everything they make.  The servers are always sweet and polite. We really enjoy that they wear all 50's style outfits and keep this fun, throwback atmosphere in the place.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-GR5YPowbsGnD6qQ0jHzUw.text: 5 stars for the Naughty Pecan Pie! Don't expect an amazing lunch/dinner- like the other reviews say its pretty basic diner food. I did like the vegetarian sloppy joe's though- haven't had much else. We mainly come here for the pie :)

f-bFdf_jmk52Po2lrpHLWw.text: Dropped in for a nice cool soda and to talk to a good friend pre-lunch. What came to the table was a bad attitude from the waitress since we weren't ordering food RIGHT THEN and what turned out to be a $4 Dr. Pepper. If I want to blow $4 on one glass of Dr. Pepper, I'll go to The Four Seasons where the staff is polite and the decor isn't full of schlock. NEVER will return. You should think a LONG time before heading to this 'should have closed years ago' location full of nasty waitresses.

UcSDIWxWWCX5Jd9llt2CrQ.text: I love this place.  I love the vintage decor, the attached antique stores, and the overall feeling of the place.  As most of the reviews reference, McAlpines has been open since 1928 and is said to be the only surviving soda shop to make it through the Great Depression.   The staff is young, and hipster. Many sporting victory rolls or Betty Bangs. They offer great soda recommendations and are are attentive and quick.   Their food is consistent and classic. No frills, no fuss and great taste. The potato salad is awesome. I always order an extra side of it.   Their deserts are killer. Chocolate fudge for miles. My husband had a root-beer float which he swears is the best he's ever had.   There old fashioned soda fountains alter the taste of your traditional coke but for the better. They also have a ton of phosphates to choose from. Try the cherry. It's my favorite.   I hope this little place continues on for generations as a institution the the days gone by...

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate fudge Sunday.

dWBczaZ2vEydIC9C5TPzOA.text: This place is full of charm if you are nostalgic and don't mind the clutter of the adjoining shop. We stopped in for an afternoon treat, and the choices of Italian sodas and shakes will not disappoint! I loved the antique gold cash register and the vintage equipment that has been meticulously cared for. I saw they have an open faced roast beef sandwich which was one of my favorite dinners growing up so I'm looking forward to returning for that meal. The servers were very personable and made us feel very welcome also.   I thought the vintage items in the store were over priced. I realize they have to make a profit but wow I experienced sticker shock on items that I have priced elsewhere in comparison.

BP-tUgJQXC2aJbqy_nLQVw.text: What a unique place!  Love places like this.  Haven't tried the food yet, but they have a very long list of desserts, ice cream flavors, ice cream sodas, etc.  I got a soda, my wife got ice cream - both were really good.  Really fun decor - there's an antique shop as well.  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dIII4cz8zkteOFAk3pCtSA.text: Throwback soda jerk restaurant with an atmosphere to sell it fully-complete with waitresses with the old-style uniforms, mini-jukeboxes at every booth (& a big one at the front of the place), and a boutique with nothing but vintage items next door.  The menu is quaint, and features everything from sloppy joes to Fluff R' Nutters.  Didn't get to partake of the soda fountain, ice cream or pie store, but all of the other food we tried was great, so we'll be back.

9O5cRJsgujygwoDYQ1YFJg.text: Just about every time we need to go to the airport, we make a point to stop at MacAlpines.  A great trip back in the time of old-fashioned soda fountains.  When you walk in, forget the present and take some time to look at the hundreds of artifacts from "yesteryear".  I must give credit to Arizona Highways.  They ran a piece many years ago about MacAlpines.  We took a ride from Sun City all the way down to the 7th St & McDowell area and gave it a try, and have been back many, many times.    They offer many flavors of ice cream, including coffee which is more popular on the east coast.  Normally, we'll split a meal so we can make room for the sundaes that we know we shouldn't order, but we do - every time!  Friday afternoon we stopped for sundaes only.  Lindsey was our server and did an excellent job.

wLki12vK5Fmfl8gQwZ5Row.text: Well, I was originally going to give this place 3 or 4 stars but I decided to give it 5 because of the "luck" it brought me.  So I've passed this place many times on the way home from work and I've always wanted to go in. I did not realize it was a little soda shop attached to an antique store. The waitress told me to sit wherever. There was the typical soda fountain style counter and then also a medium-sized area with dining tables including booths.   The menu consist of a bunch of sandwiches and some other simple things. I asked my waitress what is the most popular and she said the Reuben. So thats what i got! It came out promptly with potato salad and a pickle on the side. It was SO good.  I finished up my meal and instead of the waitress giving me a check she said "so apparently an old friend from high school already paid for your meal so you can go whenever you want." It was so bizarre. Nothing like this has ever happened to me before! Especially not in Phoenix because I went to school in Long Island, NY.  Anyway, what a strange afternoon. Luck? Pay it forward? Someone just being generous? Someone mistaken me for someone else? I guess I will never know.

nmIJHYNopCzGxMiExl5s2Q.text: Love the place-food was okay. I had a great visit here. The place has a lot of unique antique items. Worth the visit if you love old items. They even serve the old pops. The thi g about it is I was thinking the food would be as good as the atmosphere. Well no. The food was okay food but not something that I would say I am thinking of getting any anytime soon.   The server was nice but took sometime for us to be served.  Would not comeback. I was really looking forward about this place..

hPSKCnnWm8KhkbkcaVjmiQ.text: I really liked my lunch here. The service was fantastic and everyone was super friendly. I even managed to pick up some cool earrings after my sandwich! Definitely recommend.

3q7SBqt6zTT4Ft9chTroaA.text: What a fun, hidden gem in the Phoenix area. They have a huge selection of soda fountain floats (99 to be exact, I think). Everything from cotton candy soda to amaretto flavor. The ice cream sundaes also were terrific.  The food is something to be desired though. That's why go only for the ice cream :)

fIwBqiGrsXg9WODIpseWWA.text: Well I was grumpy and frustrated when I got here... I wasn't even planning on coming here. I drove past it, as I've done a million times before, then came back when I realized my original lunch destination is closed on Mondays. As I was driving to my second lunch destination, I drove past this place again and decided to stop in. And I am so glad I did. I love the ambience. I had to do a double look around when I first walked in.... "What year am I in?" I ordered some water while I read through the menu. She brought me a cup without a straw... At first I was upset but then I noticed the old school straw container on the table. I giggled. I really giggled. Within minutes, my spirits were lifted.   Then I saw the menu. Ice cream. Soda fountain drinks. Soda with ice cream. My inner child was jumping with joy. I got squirmy. I couldn't decide what I wanted. I want it all! I want it all NOW mommy! Oh wait, mom's in CA... And I'm 37 years old... But I still want it all!   I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and old fashioned strawberry shake. The burger was pretty good. But I sat on the bench, swaying side to side, dancing in my seat to the oldies playing on the speakers, while sipping on my strawberry milkshake. I'm in love with this place. And it has such a rich history. I'm going to tell everyone I know about this place. I can't wait to bring my 7 year old Godson here.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mini jukebox at each booth.... I love this straw container. I&#39;m so easily amused.
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon cheeseburger with Hawaiian close slaw.
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old fashioned thrifty&#39;s strawberry ice cream shake.

5F6C2PRR4fIA_JEGHwyAXw.text: Loved it! Feels like you stepped back in time. Stopped in for lunch and wished I had more time to stay. Atmosphere was really great and I loved the counter. It was how I remembered as a little girl from the Bronx. I ordered the chicken salad after the waitress helped me decide after I couldn't pick between 3. Now that should say a lot since I usually know what I am in the mood for. Great menu, even on milkshakes and floats. The sandwich was very good and fresh. My float was so good I didn't mind cheating!

NeM5LUkfSdh05Q6-ItsfHA.text: MacAlpines had alot of high ratings on yelp so I was excited to give it a try. I was severely disappointed. It is somewhat cute, but seems dirty. The food was terrible and completely overpriced. If you want a burger, you will find a better one at McDonald's for $6 less. The service was not good. I sat at the old fashioned bar, where they were scooping ice cream, but was never checked on. Instead the employees were gossiping about a coworker. The icecream was something you could buy at the grocery store. Do not waste your time here. Go to Mary Coyle's instead.

wvAK2WCSevhLJpMLrPz8jw.text: Mel Brooks once said the mystery of life is the Egg  Cream. "It has no cream and no egg!" Well, maybe McAlpines does have some cream or at least whipped cream, maybe. I don't ask. I just enjoyably slurp.  Wonderful service, good simple food, phenomenal atmosphere...and today, cherry pie. Long live McAlpines!

Wh2bpb8yKp-AG1ut61yKxA.text: This place is just OK.  It does remind me of a place back in Indy that I use to go to when I was a little girl.  The ice cream float selection is very large here and they give you extra soda with your drink.  I like that.  The food was average, but tasty.  I got the hot chef special for the night, meatloaf sandwich.  It was pretty good.  The staff was friendly, but not very attentive.  They could clean the place up a bit and make it look like it did back in the day.  I think that would be worth getting more people to come in.  I did enjoy looking around the antique shop.  Lots of fun stuff.

SQaJ0884YR3V9GbMx6MsZg.text: This was a fantastic time the frist time. The main course was just okay, but the ice cream and soda was fantastic and made up for the meal. The second time was a bummer. It was crowed and with little working staff things did not get done. If you go just make sure it is not crowded and order as many soda's as you can.

JysdwgZ6oKkcDfLi4VJoAw.text: Great service, great sundaes and old school fountain creations :)  I did not try their food but will do so next time :)  Definitely a place to bring out of town friends to on a hot summer day to cool off and take some pictures :)

e-x5o5iszLNG-ni1DMjbUQ.text: Native Phoenix-er and never been in. Finally went in yesterday. Wife and I had dessert only. I thought it was good and an overload of sugar. Like the decor. Really felt like we were in the 1950's. Waitress was nice and friendly. A bit pricey but I guess the rent in Phoenix to stay open has been increasing as well. I hope they stay in business.

H2PXSuWDKHlV48Xbx9n3rQ.text: summary: waaay over-hyped diabetes in a bowl with chocolate sauce.  i'm not quite sure why people are thrilled (or why they advertise) that they use thrifty ice cream. i swear you can get that stuff at the drug store. THE DRUG STORE, people!!!! what the freak. make your own dang sundae at home!  ok, ok, i can see the appeal with the flavored floats/sodas. but i'm not much of a fizzy-water fan, and.... they weren't as mind-blowingly amazing as it sounded.   say it with me now - over *clap-clap*, rated *clap-clap*

vxMhHWLbCBfXJVD5IOzcCw.text: Another review posted on Yelp about MacAlpine's prompted me to post this review.  It mentioned some of the special features of the place, the antique store attached to a soda fountain, the ravishingly rich and delightful food servings, and so on.  But what I want to comment upon is the fact that the 1928 counter and the bar stools and all the counter and wall trappings and paraphernalia throughout is more than a representation of the way it was -- this place IS the WAY it was, and is therefore a step above just being authentic. I know.  I grew up with soda fountains like MacAlpine's as a necessary part of every drug and department store everywhere.  The MacAlpine food, however, is several steps above and more opulent than those old soda bars of the 30s and 40s.  I don't want to tell you much more -- this place is just like the Organ Stop Pizza in Mesa AZ -- they both qualify as competitors for the 8th wonder of the world award, and, well, you just have to go and find out for yourself.  You will keep going back, just like I have all 15 years I have been in Arizona !!  Wes Flinn

fx1V3mJN7U6qS9QTvFOAAg.text: what can I say?? this is old school to the way you get served ice cream!! if you have kids take them while they are young!! the food is great, and they have a cool little thrift shop.

DTTYEAR1bo9L0-Jwx8Toqw.text: Great atmosphere and delicious food! The chocolate shakes are great and the sandwiches are refreshing. Definitely a lunch spot to remember :)

5dAJhEgti0-k3w5GfOgc7A.text: This offers such a nice selection of fountain drinks.  The counter servers really dress the part.  Neat place.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vintage store side

rTqyVXN_WyenhE-ZHpZeJw.text: I loved the ambiance of this place.  I thought it was just a soda fountain shop but also a vintage shop.  They kept everything classic looking as if you were in a True old American soda fountain shop.  My sundae was delicious!

kufAEMsG6YeTCNkRWoxkzw.text: Bought a Groupon and used #1 of 3.  Not sure I will go back to use the other 2. The food was not good at all. Ordered a cheeseburger, potato salad another bacon cheeseburger and Hawaiian coleslaw.  To drink we ordered a chocolate malt and a strawberry shake. The cheeseburgers were frozen patties and cooked clean into next week. Dry hockey pucks. The potato salad was ok the Hawaiian coleslaw was very blah.. The shake and malt were delicious even though they were not delivered until our burgers were finished. The waitstaff was like the walking dead, they had not an ounce of enthusiasm. When we sat down not one person acknowledged we were there. Waitress was not friendly either. No French fries!!! Potato salad, chips, coleslaw, carrot raisin salad. Wow! This place could be a goldmine, how about a friendly staff, and pattied burgers and if you can't have a deep fryer, how about some American Fries made from good old boiled potatoes. Put it this way, you get out of the place what you put into it and this place needs to step it up!

BsSefnk8RxuaqryngEzhqQ.text: I've been coming to MacAlpine's on and off for about 8 years and I still can't get enough.  Monica and Cary (owners) are two of the most hard workers small business owners that I've had the pleasure of knowing.    MacAlpine's is Phoenix's only still existing original Soda Fountain and a True gem.  Filled with vintage decor and charm, it's a fun time warp every time I go in there.  Their shakes are delicious and so big you get the leftover serving in the metal mixing cup.  Their food is tasty and like mum made it.  They always have vintage tunes on and you can browse the antiques and collectibles next door in between dining.

mrtzxTc2UhFZF4H6UU23IA.text: Have you ever watched those dumb/boring/nerdy space documentaries that tell you lies regarding the impossibility of time travel? Some dude with a talking computer tells you "...currently, there is no way to deviate from the space-time continuum"... Lies! I'll tell you how to do it.  You don't even need to buy a time machine on eBay like Kip Dynamite. Just get into your car (no, it doesn't have to be a Delorian) and drive to 7th Ave and Thomas Rd (just south of Thomas on the E side), and BAM! You, my friend have entered another dimension.  You walk into this place and you expect to see Cowboy Biff sitting at the bar. Unfortunately, all you see is elderlies shuffling about. Well, they must know something that we all don't. Like an old man/woman secret that they only tell their peers. You, my friend, have just learned their secret! Sit down and order yourself a Black Bean Burger. What? You say you don't like vegetarian food? Well, neither do I! Trust me. Do it!  While you wait, you can imagine you are your grandpa at 12 years old. Just stopping into the local soda fountain shop to get a smooth refreshing malt. Being a 12 year old in the 1930s, you notice how modern and sleek the decor is in here. Ice cream adverts everywhere... Makes you want to stay 12 forever.  "Mom, can I have some ice cream?" Oh, I mean "Sorry, can I get a strawberry malt with that Black Bean Burger? Ahem, thanks..."

ZPM-hwNuKTXrgBqeU2008Q.text: Love this spot, the BLT and potato salad are to die for! Shakes, malts italian sodas are amazing too. Seems like there is a lot of staff turnover (or maybe they just have a lot of staff), they are usually good but some of them are lacking in customer service skills. The owners are great though, always on site and friendly :)

tDZbVJoEx8mZNgvqhJj59g.text: Great experience! I got "The Brady Bunch" it was really sweet but it tasted very good. I also had the homemade Black Bean Veggie Burger. It was very good too.

9sVzimgtWTTOa8b1t0WQkA.text: I'm sad to say that I wasn't in love with MacAlpine's.  The fact that the building has never been restored is cool, in a dirty kind of way.  The floors will never be clean enough, because they are so old.  That may seem ridiculous, but cleanliness is important to me when I'm eating somewhere.  Our server was odd, but helpful and attentive.  We spent a good amount of time oogling the random items displayed throughout and were entertained with our surroundings.  The food is where I saw the problem- my Mac Cheeseburger was bland and tasteless.  My broccoli and cheese soup was below average.  I wasn't impressed one bit.  We ended up having dessert.  I opted for a single scoop of Chocolate Malt Krunch, which I'd never had before and didn't love (total personal preference as my friend loved it).  MacAlpine's is cool, but I think purely as a place to get something sweet.

c-5B83x07BrmrXEyM2h5fQ.text: This place has it all.  Start with atmosphere as there is absolutely no way to ignore it.  In a mad jumble of antiquities ranging from the 20's to the 70's every item is either a conversation piece, memory or a must have.  I bought a mod 60's chappeau my baby brother picked out as being "me" and I am eyeing a full bonnet hair dryer the size of a rice cooker :p  Onto the soda fountain.  There are egg creams, hot fudge and a toe curling number of flavor possibilities. I always want to cook up something outrageous to try but seem to drift toward their amazing executions of classic favorites.  The regular menu is exactly as it should be.  I have yet to be bold enough to try their Hawiian cole slaw (so 50's) but all of their soups, sides, etc. taste home made with reasonable prices.  I was reading through the reviews here and saw a couple mentions of split pea soup ... how is it I've never been when they've had it?!?!  I am now on a mission to go when it is being served.  On a side note, MacAlpine's serves stuffed tomotoes!  Your choice of tune or chicken salad, I imagine they'd do egg if you asked over greens and surrounded by lots of veggies, etc.  It's the kind of dish to inhale after killing yourself at the gym and you won't feel all that bad about it.  P.S. Sometimes the service can seem a bit oddly timed but when you take into account the division of labor and the nature of the place it does make sense.  Also, I once brought a friend in here who needed to sober up a bit and our server didn't turn a hair despite some truly outlandish observations on my friend's part.

OHQG7iHW-rBLEhgaIrneAg.text: This is the oldest operating soda fountain in the Southwest (from 1928!).  good jukebox ... and they have REAL phosphate sodas and malts (very very yummy!) ... as well as your typical soda fountain stuff (circa 1928-50's) ... It's cool as hell but I wish they would have restored the place rather than keeping it "as is" ... it's a little rugged from the years but very cute and REAL.  I gotta say ... it really is a MUST see for all!

4hAnlhqbjs-RviHVs2dwxw.text: I was eager to give this place a try and headed on out on my day off.  I was sure that there was going to be more on my plate when I ordered the Ruben Pastrami sandwich.  It was rather small....boo....I don't like potato salad or coleslaw, macaroni salad or stuff like that but I also don't like potato chips!  I was disappointed there was no fries. I ordered the Cole Slaw since I don't hate it *as much* as potato salad.  Well, hmm...it was OK.  I had the cherry lime egg creme. It was OK too...I'm used to it with ice in it though.  The Chocolate malt was...lacking malt.  The good side of all this was the antiques!  Wow, what a great cute place for antiques! A little over priced but fund just the same.  I'll go back but only to look at the antiques and maybe try some different sodas.

2k0M4cNnyBk05dWih0gjxQ.text: A Blast from the past! We had an office just down the street and found this place to be great for eating in and taking out. A friendly staff is attentive and the food is pretty good. The stuff that litters the walls gives the restaurant character and a unique charm.  Oh yeah! And the soda fountain drinks are out of is world!

PgwAIejH_Lk3lFzWZI1QkQ.text: About Alpines by far one  of the most disgusting places I ever ate the service was beyond unprofessional I basically sat myself while a group of waiters were having a decisions about their weekend in front of other customers behind there bar instead of directing my party to our table. The worst part  gets worse after the male took our order  and constantly making us repeat yourself more then twice because he seem to keep for getting. I went with getting a Ruben sandwich  when I go to put mustered on my samwitch found a small roach in it  the owner offered me a discount on my next meal instead of refunding my money why the hell would I ever go back if I found a insect in my damn food beyond disgusted. Cool throw back set up  but disgusting where the food is made and the owners feel sorry for the people that work there wouldn't be surprised if the health department shut them down.

fp0tA815VPlAJWl_YL0hPw.text: Nice lil' hidden gem of history. Eat at the counter w/the swivel chairs and friendly gals. Food is good. After, go look around and found a treasure from the past. Fun to pass a bit of time there. Give it a whirl. Doesn't look like much from inside, but fun inside.

2TRj0JeSrs3D__3OfXoLcg.text: I confess, I can't drink regular soda. So I wasn't able to enjoy the big selling point of the store. But my friends enjoyed them and couldn't recommend them enough.  I like the vibe of the store, the decor, and the friendly staffs. I had the Coney Island Hotdog (Chilli Cheese Dog) with potato salad. I like how the chili and the potato salad are store made and not bought. You can taste the difference in flavor and in freshness.  Will definitely go back with other soda drinking friends.

2Ds6nC-A_MtNebEsj5Q3BQ.text: I wandered in here after a day at the library with my mom, sister, and my niece and nephew. Adorable-love the retro vibe. The junk on the walls is enough to keep me distracted until my food arrives and the waitresses looked awesome, in their retro outfits. Prices were decent and the food was pretty good. I definitely want to go back and try the ice cream.

-FdQu46kY90UtZ-kMDwj5g.text: Dropped into MacAlpines sadly after already having eaten lunch on a lazy Sunday afternoon. I just wanted to check out the antiques & wasn't disappointed at all. Can't wait to return for a lunch in the near future. Thanks MacAlpinnes for letting me lose myself inbetween the antiques & vintage clothes. You're the bestest!

1fARd8_VPw3ItgtKi5_NVA.text: Family owned business that serves up the best one of a kind flavors of soda floats I've ever experienced. I had "Breakfast at Tiffany's," and can't wait till my next sweet tooth to go back.

-G2ztQUq9VSBHB6Q5VTxaQ.text: I had a cheese burger here last night. The patty tasted as if it had been heated more than once and possibly had a visit with the microwave, no flavor and chewy.  The service was great and the food came out fast (yay, for microwaves!) but I will never return.

xcYMDqwXuWkc99BU4vMz-Q.text: Read about it in some Phoenix guidebook, it is one of a kind place that is for sure. Place is located between two antic furniture stores so when you walk in you have furniture all around and then you walk into an old cafe. Witnesses are dressed the part since the placed opened in 1928 and look super cute, everyone is very friendly. I ordered beautiful green pistachio shake that was out of this world. Cool place to visit.

nH43rTsfAC9Se1G-LbsYsA.text: Been living in Arizona for almost 4 years now finally went too this place they have the best Reuben sandwich and also there potatoes salad and can't forget there awesome dessert . Great place

vwBnuHcc65wJf_DNZgfICQ.text: I love this place. Me and my buddy went and got floats one day. Today im leaving the Phoenix art museum. As im passing it I decide to grab a float. I got  orange soda vanilla float. So freaking good. I recommend sitting at the bar. Old school bar stools bolted into the ground. great atmosphere, and you can enjoy a great list part of American culture.

vBjkAAEze02vxo4SaPrCZw.text: Who puts celery in chili?  No french fries?  Carrot and raisin salad on the menu?  Cute old-fashioned decor, but really I just wanted to dust the place.

g_iDOvdfxvI7rb22CvOmiA.text: A great blast from the past.  They have all of the old time favorites, and a soda fountain.  Great shakes and cherry cola made from scratch.  Great sandwiches.  Don't leave without trying the potato salad.    And after lunch, you can visit the vintage store with old clothes, furniture, and jewelry.

Tl2lL5MW-D1Uf32auYI9fw.text: I love this place I went here with a living social. I love old fashion feel places. This is def a phx jem! I had a fancy soda and ice cream basically a amazing soda cream drink that tasted like a pie! I love their uniforms here too reminded me of a serendipity :)

OYuZqB_tnYQ2OBZ4q3MndQ.text: This is the best soda fountain I've ever had, AND I must say your boutique is to die for.  Every meal, every shake, every salad, are wonderful, AND your staff, the family, are warm and friendly, and have made me feel at home.

0dII_2H8Q2XEFSbqjOz2XA.text: I visited Mac Alpine's the day after Christmas with my family in hopes to have the best shake in town, but what we experienced was that and so much more. When we walked in it was like we stepped back in time. Before we even sat down to eat and enjoy the famous shakes, we adventured through the store where we found antique pieces from a plethora of eras. Each room held treasures from several decades. It was so much fun hearing my dad tell stories of how some of these items were what he grew up with. The manager Monica was a pure delight and made sure we enjoyed every second of our journey through this amazing and fascinating place! The food, memories, and flashbacks are ones I will not forget and will quickly return to enjoy it once more.

H_KHVJuCz_8eNidbBK_uzA.text: I love this place.  I'm not much for the soda fountain offerings, but that's because I am always stuffed after I've eaten whatever I ordered.  I love the 'old' standbys...the egg salad sandwich and mushroom soup!  or the blt!   The wait staff is adorable.  And we get to do a little vintage shopping , too.

JK6a5IRnPg1tQA3FruwaQw.text: If you want an authentic old fashioned ice cream soda fountain, you found it.  Any ice cream item is worth trying, the food is pretty good but can't compare to the outstanding sundaes and sodas.  It's also a nice touch to see the servers dress up in authentic 30s and 40s attire.

mEqhs4XmLs7dfwWGW7Z7_g.text: The only reason I would give this place a 1 star rating is due to their amazing soda and float selection. The food was absolutely disgusting. I never complain about food and I've definitely never sent food back, until tonight. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and was shocked to see that fries aren't even offered as a side. I took one bite of the burger and found bone fragments in the frozen beef. My sister also sent back her bean/veggie burger. It looked equally disgusting. It will take a lot of convincing to get me to go back.

Ix8hr98w2hCFollJMJ8QqQ.text: I've been here a few times already and I can say this place has the best old fashioned malts and ice cream treats like banana splits It's perfect for a summer date when the temps get to 110 and above as well ;). The food isn't anything to write home about as it is just decent diner type food, but I go here for the ice cream and treat drinks. They also have an awesome variety (99) of syrup flavors to use in their ice cream sodas and shakes, as well as their "egg creams" and phosphates (their flavor sodas with extra tang) My favorite shake there is a vanilla shake with wedding cake flavored syrup and even better with malt. I also enjoy just stopping by and getting one to go as an occasional afternoon treat.

Rik0OfvPIkMq3MinwlfKYA.text: Excellent food, fantastic shakes, old fashion soda fountain is the bomb. Prices are great!

y39R2Ezg4CPA2x9hnvk_vw.text: Food was just ok, the place is a novelty. The strawberry soda I ordered was pretty bad. It was just some inexpensive Thrifty ice cream in a glass with strawberry soda syrup, this is not an old fashion soda fountain soda. I would somewhat recommend it just for all the throw back antiques and the food  was just ok.

RS-ifd8deiKO-NB4F0O7Nw.text: Quaint little soda shop with delicious sandwiches and fun drinks...cannot wait to go back to Phoenix to try another soda flavor on their menu!

z7nNzamGGwW0mJHysw3x9g.text: Love this venue! The staff is always very friendly, and the pies are delicious! My favorite are pecan and apple. I really recommend the coffee as well, which is overlooked. The options for ice cream flavors are very varied, but I must note the are no sugar free, dairy free or low fat options. Servings are big, and reasonably priced. Also, parking is always available,  which is a plus.

5llNnwazqDLl8QRrDvGJtQ.text: This is a unique soda/ ice cream/ thrift store/gift shop all under one roof. There are many creative selections of savory treats that is sure to satisfy that sweet tooth. I definitely come back for the banana split or other desserts yet not impress with the food selection.  The burgers are basic with sides of potato salads, chips, etc.If you are looking for fries or chicken fingers, you won't find it here. If you want to try the Malibu chicken sandwich, don't bother. Maybe it was my luck but the chicken looked horrible and tasted even worse than it looked.   The gift shop needs an over haul and the thrift store could use a deep cleaning. I feel this shop has definitely seen better days.   Overall, I feel with some TLC,  this business could be a 4 star.

rYZ3XNrndkJ_HIm-Tu2HIw.text: I had an uncontrollable urge for an old fashioned soda so Yelped "soda fountain drinks" in the area. MacAlpine's popped up with some good reviews. From the outside we would never have walked inside!  This antediluvian restaurant/coffee shoppe is really pushing the limit on dirty vs nostalgic. The wait staff were dressed in mismatched outfits, grungy socks and shoes. The shelves in the restaurant itself are packed full of ageless classic memorabilia. It was fun to sit and let your eyes wonder over everything ~ almost overwhelming. We're talking "out of control packed"!  Walking in we really did not know if we were in the right place because you don't walk directly into the restaurant. There are technically three rooms that cross in the center room which is the restaurant. Each of the side rooms are small and hold antiques, clothing, furniture pictures and misc. items.   Our waitress was friendly and service was OK. I had an old fashion soda with lime syrup, vanilla ice cream and a shot of phosphate. It was refreshing. The hubster had a tuna melt and a root beer shake. There is plenty on the menu to please any palate.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A Green River but with vanilla ice cream added

RIBiG8ES-kbe1JtpxZTwpg.text: I want you to google a open face turkey sandwich with gravy. You see how wonderful they look that is NOT what I got. It was piece of bread with cold cuts that after one bite I (and I didn't swallow it) didn't taste fresh. The potato's were cold and chunky and the gravy was from a can. The salad was wilted but the carrots in the salad were good but the ranch dressing was runny and watered down. In my personal opinion my dinner sucked. My son's burger looked wrong and as it was a cooked perhaps it was microwaved or maybe cooked and then put away and then just heated up. He's 9 and said dad this is the worst and my son has eaten at a ton of places and been very brave at times. My wife and daughter didn't want to be linked to this review so they said it was nothing special at all. We had ice cream too but its nearly impossible to mess that up so they don't get stars for scooping it out of a bucket.   I understand the charms of this place, this next to new store that also serves food. My daughter purchased a cool little coat and read a newspaper about John F Kennedy being shot and no, they do not get a point to teaching a bit about history. God I had high hopes for this place I read the views and even the bullet holes in the glass in the front windows (they really do look like bullet holes) didn't keep me from there. I've eaten at places all over and the neighborhood does not make a restaurant bad. Its the owners or the cooks or wait staff that can bring a place down. The wait staff were super polite and dressed cute in 1950s uniforms so that was an effort. For 4 people it was about $80.00 which my wife said when we got into the car she felt really cheated and let down. She was 100% disappointed because I told her to pick a place we had never been to. She even said sorry on the way to the event tonight. I said it was not your cooking and you did your research.   Maybe the cook had just quit and they had a new one but when I was a cook the servers would yell at me if the dish needed to be cleaned up or you expect me to serve this and get a tip? Remake it and make it look like the pictures so I can get a good tip and I don't kill you after we close the kitchen. That is what makes a restaurant work where everyone cares about it from the cooks, waitstaff to the busboys everyone works together like a machine to make sure the place will continue. I just don't know if this one will.   Good Luck out there.

Yfe6MFOuHvFD-v2K7qYKdQ.text: Wonderful slice of old Phoenix with great big slices of great American apple pie. Atmosphere is old wooden booths, service is fast and personable.  Fun to wander the antique and collectibles too.  Family owned and love it.

_XGeXt86avC27Vq0jDVonw.text: I recently moved to Phoenix & spotted MacAlpine's by accident on Yelp. I checked out the photos, then the reviews and then the menu and knew I had to visit. After having dinner nearby  I stopped by just a bit before they closed on a weekday and it wasn't very busy. I know that this place must be hopping on the weekends though. What a gem! So many options: salads, sandwiches, ice cream sodas, floats, shakes, sundaes and all types of ice cream galore. We were greeted right away and placed our order for "The grasshopper" Mint chocolate chip icecream with hot fudge, crushed oreos and whipped cream as well as "Mud pie" Coffee icecream with hot fudge and oreos. Both were fantastic and delicious. What a cool vibe this little restaurant has, it felt as if you were back in a time warp. We loved it and will be back! Not just for the icecream but also for the shop and all it's unique vintage stuff. Very cool. So glad I found MacAlpine's.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The grasshopper &amp; mudpie sundaes.
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vDp-P8_C3uWFOGXxEbm84A.text: The second star is because I had an absolutely wonderful experience the first time I came here! It was earlier this year and there was only one employee working at that time, but he was so friendly and welcoming! He gave great suggestions for drinks and it was just overall great service and amazing experience. The decorations are also just so cute, I love the juke boxes on the tables!  My first time at Macalpine's was so great that I came back again today! It was like an entirely different place. We walked in an hour before close and were greeted by dirty looks from the two girls working. I totally understand being somewhat annoyed with people coming in when you're getting ready to close - I've worked several jobs in the food industry - but at every one of those places, we'd put on a smile and treat them the same whether it was an hour before closing or a minute before closing.  I just asked for the drink menu, not realizing the ice cream section was on the food menu. I didn't want to bother the girl again so I went to pick up what I thought was the food/ice cream menu from the counter myself. The girl just came to our table and took them away, only saying, "That's the kids' menu" pretty rudely.  The cherry on top was that it somehow ended up being over $9 for a hot fudge sundae. It was listed as 6.59 in the menu, and even with 10% tax and 15% tip that shouldn't have been much over $8 unless toppings were extra, but all I had on it was the caramel, fudge, and whipped cream, all of which were listed under what came on it. And it's not like I really care about an extra dollar or two, but it was definitely not worth nearly $10 for 2 scoops of subpar ice cream and terrible service.   This is actually the worst review I've ever left for any place, but I was just so disappointed after having had such a great time the first time I tried it. This place might be worth the high prices if you really like the nostalgic atmosphere, but I personally don't think I'll be returning.

GqLMeTl8rfwAmqpchvslyA.text: I think its safe to say, you come to this place for the vibe, and experience, not the food. I've been coming here on and off for a few years, and it basically is the same experience each time. The food is just okay, the service is just okay.....the pricing is average and so are the desserts (at least from what ive had). It truly is the history of the place, and its darling decorations that keep me coming back. Unfortunately, that has nothing to do with my appetite, and since I cant just go in there to hang out and escape 2016, I have to order something.   You could spend hours looking at all of the items they have, in the front shop and the vintage clothing part....its just so neat to take a step back, and forget that your right off 7th st in the middle of rush hour. Do I think its worth experiencing? Yes. Do I crave their food? No. Honestly, I only come here when they do a groupon. Because unfortunately there are many many places nearby that have way better food, and service. They just cant offer the inside this place does. Its worth stopping in, but not sure its a place I could ever be a regular out, unless the up'd the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. bacon cheeseburger with potato salad
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U1HG4-PGTa-Ct71g-lwg9w.text: **I want to start by saying I do not like giving bad reviews but need to warn future guests. ** Their soda shop and ice cream is out of this world. The old fashion soda shop is what gave you two stars. And the kind waitress with a electric personality.  Bad news is their food menu. I was hoping for at least fresh meat frozen would have been okay. The all beef aka ground hamburger is a few days old. The patties are prolly pre made and microwaved. My son literally burnt his mouth. They microwave pre cooked old meat and melt cheese on it. Bad business. I refused to eat mine let my boyfriend stomach my food. Smh. The owner needs to stop collecting junk and hire a better cook.  Do not eat their meat. Id love to see how they stored it. Kinda disgusted.  But lesson learned.

LQHJLQlcVb0wtI3NVdBToQ.text: Charming restaurant inside a vintage store. This restaurant boasts unique and delicious soda options. I opted for the Cherry Vanilla Phosphate, which was delicious and a bit sour. For lunch I ordered the Dagwood, which was comprised of turkey, ham, egg, salad, lettuce, tomato, and cucumber on rye. The sandwich was delicious, filling, and reasonably priced. This little gem is a must visit for anyone in the area. The one issue I had was the food lacked a bit of salt, but this wasn't a big enough issue for me to drop the stars.   Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Salad
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Dagwood

uzY6iU49CfPbNMZjB7VQ4A.text: Wow. The ice cream float, Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, was delicious and there are so many flavors to choose from you'll have a hard time narrowing it down. I'll definitely be back to try another flavor. And with an antique store attached, it's all my favorite things wrapped up into one!

I81CoqZig60foxrBaqIkGA.text: Perfect old fashioned soda fountain! The fam and I are visiting from Cali and our daughter wanted a shake. Yelped this place and - wow! Very laid back atmosphere. Wonderful young ladies behind the counter scooping, mixing and serving every manner of sundaes, shakes, sodas, you name it! Ordered a burger and potato salad and the burger is homemade and huge! The potato salad is like your mom used to make! Stuffed but satisfied.. Great find!!

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

G3avdqb6r9MsEH0Rbayd1A.text: I thought that the old school diner vibe of this place was really fun and cool. I can see why this is a popular place for the atmosphere and the unique style of the restaurant. However, the desserts were just okay. I got the rocky road sunday and its plain thrifty ice cream, not that I'm totally hating on thrifty ice cream, it's just nothing special. My wife got one of their ice cream sodas the pineapple-upside down cake and this was super super sweet until all the ice cream started melting and then it got pretty good. Overall, I would come back just because the vibe is cool but there are definitely much better places in the valley for ice cream and desserts.

XimCp0hx1JiLAfdojpRPaw.text: Ok where do I start? It's old timey, it's a store, everything in there is from 1950s...but they have Apple Pay! :).   The food was delicious, I ordered the ham sandwich with potato chips and WAS NOT disappointed at all! The food was very delicious and my experience here was top notch from food to service!  The food literally was very tasty in every bite. The server was very attentive and the soda choices are pretty much endless. It's like having draft beer options for soda! It's amazing! I also loved the ice cream!  At the end I loved he surprised look on the owners face when I showed them I was able to pay for my meal with my watch. Then sat around and talked to them about it. It really did feel like I was at home and I'm glad that this place is in my town!

5pL3KiyBBSE5aobQ2v5tUw.text: If u need. A good old school mid west stick to your belly come here.  Sloppy joe was great. And the Synder was awesome!!! Great place to bring kids and adults alike

hIhUAuMrr-keAg7VjvYBCw.text: MacAlpine's is the favorite of my grandkids, my friends, and myself!  I have eaten at MacAlpine's many times, and have never been disappointed!  I especially love watching the cute, friendly girls make ice cream creations!  It takes me right back to the soda fountain in my small-hometown, as a child! Thanks for the memories!!

bJ1c_2Fxm-4TY1NdWoA2VA.text: OK: call me 'weird' here: but; I liked the funky (very) Old School ambiance of MacAlpines when my fiance and I went there this past Sunday for the Studebaker and friends car show.  Admittedly; I was there once before ca. 1999 and was NOT impressed but things have def improved IMHO.  I had a Club sandwich and it was one of the best ones I've ever had, at least in recent years. Would eat one again. The chocolate milk shake was OK but could have used a tad more syrup but, I'd have one again.

IN04djgifflzNIxiF_8DtQ.text: I used to drive by Mac Alpine's everyday on my way to work and was always curious about what they had to offer.  It took me awhile to make it a point to stop in, but man am I glad that I did.  This is truly one of Phoenix's historic gems.  It's like stepping back in time, everything around you transports you back to the late 50s early 60s.  The food is great, and so is the assortment of ice cream/soda flavors.  Added bonus~Vintage shop on site!

fakMH5HGlFKTUZPy5izKBQ.text: Walking into MacAlpines is like stopping the clock and turning it back to the turn of the century.  You can get ice cream goodies there that you simply can't get anywhere else reguardless of price. My wife and I have been here bofore but only for ice cream.  This time we ate at the little tables in the back.  Service was quick, efficient, and very nice.  Wife had a Reuben (she always has a Reuben which makes her an expert on Reuben's I guess.) She declared it one of the best she's eaten.  I had a seafood salad sandwich.  My sandwich was delicious.   Both came with really GOOD potato salad.  I mean good!! After that we each had an ice cream soda.  A real ice cream soda.  Rose's was cherry with vanilla ice cream.  Mine was chocolate soda with Chocolate ice cream.  We were both stuffed to the gills when we left. Total price: 30$ including ice cream, and drinks.

f2SGc6_-HaosJiKmbEtxvQ.text: Stopped in here on a Sunday afternoon for a milkshake when my sister was visiting from out of town. We browsed the racks of vintage clothing and costume jewelry before sitting down at the bar. It was difficult to choose our milkshake flavor, given the dizzying array of syrups and ice cream combos, but after settling on chocolate and wild cherry, we were very pleased. Plus it was a cheerful looking thing, topped with whipped cream, colorful sprinkles, and a cherry. I was not as pleased with the service... it wasn't busy until after we sat down, but no one took our order or even gave us a menu or a "hello" until we'd been sitting for about 10 minutes. A party of 8 or so, including a bunch of indecisive kids, sat down AFTER us, and were served before my sister and I... and no acknowledgement of the wait. While we waited, I did enjoy looking at all the cool decor from the past, though I think the whole place could be a little bit cleaner.

E8frTvl70YgCZo23nb3_DQ.text: So this place is not a great place to take your kids for some ice cream .  I give the Ice cream four stars because its wonderful. The service gets three stars... not so great.  The food gets two stars...stay away from the turkey burger the meats gray and has no taste.  The daily special is your best bet if you are really hungry and cant wait to go someplace better.  The decor is nice and authentic for its time but I don't understand why it has an antique shop attached to it.  There isn't even a door separating the restaurant from a huge amount of vintage clothing.  Vintage cloths and kids with sticky fingers don't mix.  Of course my son wanted to look at all the vintage stuff and when he tried on an old hat (with my permission) an older woman(maybe the owner) yelled at him and told him " the vintage cloths are not for dress up".  I was going to buy the hat for him because I could tell that  he really liked it but if he cant even try it on I don't see the point.  We left the so called Ice Cream shop/Goodwill disappointed and a little angry that we had spent so much over $100 on food and ice cream for the family.  Even though this is an ice cream shop I wouldn't take your kids.

POXOu3KaR5umA1KfitR-KA.text: Fantastic selection of sodas! I highly recommend the red velvet cupcake flavor as an ice cream float! The food is mediocre, but the family that owns the shop are very nice and offer great service.

nHr_uGLs0PsSNk-51rPw7w.text: this place is a straight throw back to simpler times.... when you just wanted to sit down and have yerself a dog and a soda... and a float, and a sundae....   plus, after yer done fillin' yerself up with all the delicious foodie goods, feel free to walk it off as you meander and shop yer way through the vintage offerin's.   good food, great antiquing, amazing atmosphere.

wXhZwag8I28MBleV3ZNHmA.text: I haven't been to a soda shop like this since I was a kid in the 1970's.  The atmosphere is a throw-back to the 1930's or 40's, and it was, indeed, a great pleasure to sit in the ambiance, view all the eclectic antiques/nostalgia both in the restaurant and its attached stores, and have a wistful memory of the "old days."  The waitstaff was quick, well-versed in the menu, and very helpful and pleasant.  Having read all the reviews of the food, we ate before we arrived, desiring only ice cream.  Boy, they have a selection.  I mean items I haven't seen in 40 years.  My wife and I each ordered 2-scoop sundaes, figuring that one scoop would not be enough.  When a concoction as tall as my arm is long ended up on the table, I immediately remembered how it was "back in the day" when people actually gave you a hefty helping, rather than skimped/chinced on portion size.  The Rocky Road was the best I've ever had.  This sundae was the "real deal," packed with toppings, whipped cream, sauce, etc.  Here, they make them like they "used to" and boy was that a pleasant surprise.  Truly a great and delicious experience.  I'll be back for more ice cream items.  Can't believe how much treat you get for your $ !!!

Mqo1ap3wOZ-tgI1RaXVOhQ.text: MacAlpine's has sat in the same exact location near downtown Phoenix since 1928. As far as I can tell, that's longer than any other establishment in the Valley. The cookie dough shake I had was delicious. It's not hard to forget you're in the 21st century the moment you walk in, since the only thing you'll find inside that's less than several decades old are the waitresses.

Qks3epdEUW-ldCw5CMmalA.text: Looking to grab a bite at a historic local gem in the heart of the city that's cozy, casual, and good for all types of people? Look no further than Mac Alpine's Soda Fountain on 7th Street and Oak. Located in downtown Phoenix, this original soda fountain established in 1928 is the last one of its kind and an original of the Southwest. Equipped with a diverse menue of inexpensive but delicious soups and sandwiches, Mac Alpines is the place to go for a good old fashioned malt, shake, soda, or sundae. Good quality service, and historic memorabilia make this dining experience all the more wonderful. Also, don't forget your pocket change! Mac Alpines is also home to an amazing jukebox that plays old 45s! The perfect place to listen to some real oldies, with a date, or a group of friends!

rwUtMqmSxcgT04O-77abzQ.text: I found the place very freindly and was very helpful I had planned my birthday party there and they made it feel very comfortable and they were very accomadating . We dressed the part and that was a lot of fun. My guests were very pleased and made them feel like teenagers all over again!  the hamburgers were wonderful and the ice cream soda, well what can I say ! Awesome ! everyone was in Awwa trying to figure what flavor they wanted. So many to choose.It is a small place only sits about 55 but it does fit the theme.     They do have antique areas hugging the shop,one on each side of it.one side clothing the other furniture. Yes it does have an old smell to it ,hence antique.But once you sit at the booth and get a wiff of the hamburgers it all goes away.Waitresses were happy to pose for pictures in fact they are in the calender they sell that reflicts the era.Can't say enough you just have to stop by and give it a try.

6Dr-So6dVyaqZ75i3THC_Q.text: I would be hesitant to rate this so high, because I love me my good antique stores. But I went in to browse their men's dress outfits because we are looking for a vest for my husband to be. Well, we found it! I can't believe we found it so easily. The lady was so nice and told us she would hold it for 24 hours so we can look some other places before making the final decision. The way the place is set up is so awesome.
