I loved how the little diner was in the middle. We were going to go there but just felt like something different for dinner. The whole feel of this place is completely unique and fun. The store is all spread out so you never have someone breathing down your neck asking what you want. I will definitely be back to this place. Probaby today :)

-3M1PBlwnEAQqqzHu4il2g.text: This place is fun to walk into, as it really looks like you're walking into a Depression era drugstore, not the 50's. It's crammed with old pharmacy stuff and signs, just lots to look at. I really wanted to love this place but I can't because the service just isn't what it should be. We were helped by two of the staff during our visit, one very friendly waitress who breezed by and said hello  and a waiter who couldn't have appeared more miserable.   I was surprised at how small and, hate to say it, dull, the menu is. Burgers, hot dogs and cold sandwiches. The burgers are from frozen patties and I actually had to pull a big chunk of cartilage out of my mouth. Yuck. They use Thrifty brand ice cream and have an extensive menu of ice cream sodas made with unusual flavors. We ordered our sundaes and for some reason, they were made one at a time, so that my companion was halfway through with his before mine was delivered, and it was completely wrong. Wrong ice cream, wrong topping. But it took so long to get that I just ate it. I'm not going to complain too bitterly over ice cream. And I hope this place works out its kinks and does well.

jHdnKQ9sD-3jKpKEN1BI5g.text: Mouth is watering just thinking about this place!!  The boyfriend and I FINALLY decided to try it out after passing it for almost a year. I loved how they kept it True and retro. Very cute inside. The service was very poor. Our waitress was sitting up at the soda bar eating when we walked in, then sat us down, handed us menus, didn't greet us and told us to just ask if we have questions to ask the table behind us since they apparently had a lot that she had answered before we arrived. Most awkward intro ever. We did have a lot, since it was our first time there and we didn't know how the menu worked. We ended up ordering a butterscotch-cookie dough ice cream soda and a fudge sundae with pistachio and vanilla ice cream, topped with whipped cream and nuts. OMG it was soooo yummy!! Biggest sundae I had ever been served! And you can bet I ate that entire thing!  When we got our bill we couldn't believe how cheap it was for all that amazingness! We can forgive the customer service because that's not the main reason we went there in the first place.

HdvtUdFOIltMZwITLEZLHg.text: Great sandwiches and a real soda fountain.  Try a cherry lime phosphate.  Trust me.

eICdTUBFVFrbBHpz0JnGfg.text: The yesteryear theme, decor and atmosphere gets 5 stars indeed. Great jukeboxes at each booth (2 Plays for a quarter) vintage everything everywhere with sensory overload in a good way ... the food was Ok but not  as noteworthy as the ambiance ... wait staff was friendly and service was prompt even though it was very full at 1pm when I ate there .... will I return? the verdict is still out but probably yes to just try a milkshake which I hear from other reviews is worth the price ...

FKN6Sfjb4HSkPkGxQU45Wg.text: I miss this place.  I used to work right across the street from McAlp's and would go there at least twice a week.  The atmosphere is great, food is good, and deserts are tasty.  Its nice to see that some places in the Phoenix area don't feel the need to constantly renovate and are not afraid to keep their days gone by look, feel and approach to business.  Writing this is making me hungry for their food again.  I need to find an appointment to schedule downtown so I can lunch there next week.

xpN3mvffqZYIphNGC-_58w.text: If there were 10 Stars, I would give it 10 stars!!!!!!  Thank you Thank you THANK YOU my dearest Junior for introducing me to MacAlpines!  This is My absolute favorite Place.  Walk In here, and feel like you have traveled back in time, so amazingly kept original!  Wooden Booths with a hat rack at each end, sooo cool!!  Eat their Mouthwatering food while you sing along to the coolest oldies overhead.   I must say my favorite meal is a tie between their Egg Salad and Chicken Salad Sandwich... mmmmmmmm... oh and their split pea soup!!!  Cocunut Egg Cream Soda!!!! AND THEY SERVE THRIFTY'S ICE CREAM!! THE BEST Banana Split you will find!   And you get to shop while you wait for your food! YES! 2 rooms filled with the neatest trinkets,a room filled with amazingly classy clothes/scarves/hats/pins, a phone booth, furniature, You will want to buy it all.  You MUST check this place out.

tNx3VZxSa_KT_YL9aMIYxA.text: First of all, this place is awesome. 2nd of all this place is amazing. It is an authentic 50's soda shop / restaraunt. It's so quaint and real! Just ...To. Die. For. I even commented that I felt like I was back in the 50's and should be sitting in the back of the restaraunt. Ahem. I have a pretty sick sense of humor, but one of the waiters did laugh loudly at my sentiment. They have a list of over 50 types of sodas/egg creams, milkshakes. I was in love. I ordered a nectar egg cream and it was to . die. for. Did I mention you get free refills? Holy crap!! They served me the best Pastrami sandwhich I have ever tasted in my life.  and that's just the food. We haven't even mentioned the shopping. Loads and loads of authentic 50's furniture and clothing and other souvenirs for sale. Box purses. All at more than reasonable prices. Some at downright cheap prices.  I mean I was in love, love , love. I told my grandmother, who lives in Michigan, that when she visits me, MacAlpines is the first place I'm taking her in Phoenix.

2WCY54PWwuDqcYRzmQmxhA.text: This is one of the coolest places I've found in Phoenix. It has such a wonderful atmosphere and the employees are ridiculously friendly. I've gone back twice in one week since my first time because they have so much delicious ice cream and options to try. The first time I ever went I had an Italian Soda with Mango syrup, but they let me know that you can have as many different flavors as you want because refills are free on them. Then, I had a hot fudge sundae and it was adorable and delicious. The decorations are what really make this place amazing, but the desserts don't disappoint and the employees are so sweet and when they ran out of bananas for the banana split I originally ordered they were so nice and funny about it, I didn't even care. I guess the lunch menu could be a little better, but I really think you can get food anywhere, the experience at Macalpine's is what makes it so unique.

Zc1pRxn69t6F8rHkTiZGsQ.text: I had a craving for ice cream so tried this. The girl at the counter was seating people, taking orders, cashier in and making ice cream...even though  other people  were working!  So my ice cream was scooped then sat on the counter melting while she helped others, came back, served it to me seriously  half melted! She wss frazzled, I feel for her, but it was dissapointing! I added a pic of the mustard bottle, soooo disgusting and they were all like  that! Cool cuz it is a real old soda counter, but it could be sooooo much better! I  wish it was a cool blast from the past with a soda Jerk in a sharp uniform, but instead there  is a guy in pants and shirt too big for him! Great idea, but cleanliness is not a thing here at all! Great concept, could be a good moneymaker, oh well!

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mustard on the counter! All looked like this!

eHOI-ouCo6XkSZ-Ckz6Y9g.text: I love this place! (for the dessert, not the food; didn't try the food based on reviews) I'll be honest --we came because we saw they had a Butterbeer icecream float and we are huge Harry Potter nerds. But we ended up liking other stuff on the menu too. Where else can you get a huge icecream float with whipped cream and a cherry on top for $3.75? My friends and I each ordered a different float from their specialty menu (we were not adventurous enough to make up our own combo) and we each loved what we ordered. I would've drank all of mine if it hadn't been so huge.   I also love the strange kitschy inside that's kind of dusty and vintage and odd. The sad part was the jukebox at our table was broken. Next time I'll play a song for sure!  Only gripe is that it closes at 8. Don't they know most people want dessert between the hours of 8-10 pm??

VmP69sGZBaNB3gDjBc609A.text: Highly recommend this place! First time here with no idea what to expect. As soon as I walked in I was greeted and found a good spot to sit. Not a minute later was helped with drinks by our waitress. I ordered the Rhetts Butler float and loved it. The chicken Ceasar Salad was great! Awesome atmosphere and all around fun experience. I highly recommend to anyone with a sweet tooth

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gentlemen prefer blondes

x8FGjF2LWY_iXaHDE4s5xQ.text: Wow!!  We found this little hole-in-the-wall place and decided to try it just for fun. It is now my new go-to place.   First, the service is second to none. These girls go above and beyond. Anything you need they are on it (of course it was a bit slow that day but still...).   Second, they serve hot and cold sandwiches and salads. We ordered a sloppy joe (yum) and a club sandwich to share. As clubs go this was delicious. The bacon cooked to perfection. Good fresh meats and cheeses. Prob best club Sammy ever.   Third, ice cream soda fountain!!! I ordered the Bettie Page (cheesecake soda w/strawberry ice cream). Beautiful!!! They have about 20 flavors to try. Also thrifty ice cream (a whole bunch of flavors). All in all you should definitely try this place.

zDz2YpJZJ9pOtGaiPFHgpA.text: We went here to try the ice cream sundaes and soda floats. It was an interesting experience.  It was nice that they have so many soda flavors to choose from. They let you sample 3 different soda flavors, if you are like me, and can't decide. The turtle sundae was ok.  They do have an eclectic collection of nostalgia available for purchase which is fun to look at.   I was surprised by the lack of cleanliness. The floor was sticky throughout the restaurant and under our table was very dirty. It looked as if they had not mopped in some time. It was also very warm. Part of the building that is used as the store did not appear to have any ac. It was almost as warm inside as with was out.

GwCj6UgBOeIbzJy6GrdAcw.text: It has taken me tooooo long to come here.  That may be a good thing because now I am hooked.  Having been told early on that it is their soda fountain that shines and the food is just *meh*, I have only ever tried their ice cream and sodas.  Currently I am hooked on their floats and ice cream sodas.  So many soda flavors to choose from and a list of favorite flavor combos, it can be the nightmare of someone as indecisive as myself.  To date I really have only had their "Gentlemen Prefer Blondes" ice cream soda which is butterscotch soda with pecan praline ice cream.  Honestly the quality pecan praline ice cream makes this drink, with generous ribbons of caramel and toasted candied pecans mixed into creamy vanilla ice cream (thank you Thrifty!). Mix all that goodness with the butterscotch soda and YUMMM!!  I went back to try it with butterbeer flavor and didn't find it much different but still as tasty.    Having asked a few servers what their favorites were  I now look forward to trying the "James Dean " and a "Chocolate Egg Cream"....

UpYMWFUdLRY8UAP2O0ieNg.text: Really cool atmosphere. Nice antique shop to walk around in while waiting for food or polishing off a date. Had the chicken, was dry. Otherwise would have given 5 stars. Deserts and floats are really good.

ycCEu48J045Ni-cRs9hJ1A.text: Went there for the first time in a long time.   Food was mediocre at best.   Chef's salad was probably the poorest one I have had in a long time.   Vegetables were fresh and of a sufficient quantity.   However,  the hard boiled egg was food service.  No bacon, which almost always comes in a chef's salad.  Meats were the cheapest of the cheap.  Couldn't really pick out what the flavor was, with the exception of sodium.   Went here with an Entertainment BOGO.  The small print on the coupon stated after 5 PM.  I missed the fine print,  but the server didn't.  Interesting to note that they close at 7 PM.  This is a very short window.   IF we had gotten the BOGO,  the rating probably would have been a 3.    Would we come back?   Possibly after 5 PM to use the BOGO if we were in the area.  Definitely would not make this a destination, however.

i8pFlNZKRr95jhIBDTpIPg.text: I had a sloppy Joe which was great and friend had BLT also excellent. The soda funtains selections were great. Love this place. took lots of pictures of the soda fountain and antiques.   I would rate the food a 4 star but the decor 5+.  Strongly recommend.

xlK_itP-EdUN-5p_o3F4gQ.text: I always look forward to their ice cream sodas. They have great daily specials too. they have good old fashion home cookin'  Ambient - Retro.

mUMXV_PeI0r2LrQOpAPyyw.text: I think the price for adults menu is expensive, I wasn't thrill with the hot dog. The antiques are ok but again I think they are expensive. However, the customer service was good.

qop-sIC-ATCOsqhNwBiAmQ.text: The egg cream was great! The chili cheese burger, not so much. The place is fun none the less as it is set in the middle of an antique/thrift store and has a working soda fountain. My advice is to stick to ice cream and soda when you stop in.

FO3H1_mwgNMtvpepjP2JBQ.text: I really really enjoy this restaurant. I really like the nostalgic feel. The food is good. I had a ribbon that was tasty and my dad loves the egg salad  sandwich. The owner is really really nice and I love to hear her stories about the ghosts sightings. The kids really love the bears on the beach ice cream and always have a good time here.  It's really cool to see the old merchandise that's for sale like signs, old cars, luggage, cigarette machines, old stoves or jewelry. I love that the old pharmacy is where the cook is. It kind of smells old but it's so unique. I think everybody needs to check this place out at least once. Today we went with 10 people six of them being kids from 8 to 13 years old and they loved it.

b5h5kt_LcTzf0X_G8gEDjQ.text: Love this place. If you would like to bring the family into a real soda shop; MacAlpines's is perfect.  This is not a modern place by any means.  The food tastes like something your Grandmother would have made for you.  We have a lot of friends come from out of town, so before they start asking about cowboys and cactus, a little stop here is a fun place to start their trip.  Everything is good, but don't expect fancy, this is not that kind of place.    Think beverage and order a classic like an egg cream.  It is a beverage consisting of milk, carbonated water, and chocolate syrup. The drink contains neither eggs nor cream. Grandfather loved this one. Our youngest or our group alway has a chocolate malted shake.  The number of soda's you can order will blow your mind and the prices are more than reasonable.

fYCk8gABaeC-xWI2AUl2wA.text: I've driven by this place for years, and have never stopped. Big mistake, I should have stopped in a long time ago. My son a very good looking roast beef sandwich, and I had the sloppy joe. It was very good. They have 99 flavors of syrup to choose from, so picking was hard. My some had a sarsaparilla French cream soda, and i chose the Italian sarsaparilla. Both were delicious.  There is a nice old fashion lunch counter, and cozy booths. There are also some tables you can sit at if you have a larger party.  If you are looking for some antiques, or nostalgic collectibles, they have these too.  was a great experience, and my 17 y/o son said he wants to go back.

dcrbvO_KsVJkQkWYZUkHMQ.text: If you want to step back in time, this is the spot to go!!!  Vintage goodies all over, a vintage thrift shop attached , good food and GREAT ice cream creations.

U5Tz7IM14cx-isj4QeDjjQ.text: MacAlpine's has such a great old school diner feel, it's like a nostalgic blast from the past in the heart of Phoenix. The ice cream is BOMB. I got a salad and my friend got a sandwich and they were just fine, nothing special but not horrible. Service again was fine, not great but not horrible. I would come back here for a dessert though, any day!

vVB2X3o9hkOBEW5-RegXKA.text: This was my second visit and was disappointed again. The young lady waitress was having a hard time at our booth. My salad with ranch dressing came without dressing. Had to remind her for it. Wife got sloppy joe which seemed heavy with ketchup.  Doubt if I would go back for the food. Might for the Thrifty ice cream or the antiques for sale in the adjacent room. It is more old time hype than substance.  Maybe I am getting too old.

FjyuqKA_z-TJarWRyScWSw.text: This place was my favorite part of my visit here in Az! Absolutely loved everything about it! Loves the vintage clothing and collectibles and the staff was fabulous!!!

o7BBufAWZKnuIpEEOFz1vg.text: WOW! MUST CHECK OUT! MacAlpine's is an old timey soda shop mixed inside an antique shop. You walk in the door and first thing you see is the soda bar and seats. Sat down at a table and a server promptly came over and dropped menus. They have 1 entire list of the homemade sodas, milkshakes and sundaes they make. I opted for their peach tea but next time think I'm going to splurge on a cherry soda! Open the menu to a complete surprise! They are vegetarian friendly and have quite the veg selection! It was my friends birthday and they gave him a huge hot fudge sunday with a candle in it on the house. Nice touch! Will be back to try the sodas and more of the menu!   Service is great, food is great and just a great environment tripping back into the past!

48rGgE5ivomw9nKIcjvIxw.text: I absolutely love this place. I've only ever come for dessert (and to browse their selection of antique and vintage offerings) so I can't speak on their regular food. On my first trip I was disappointed to learn that they don't serve French fries (no fryer), but I've been back countless times since and I'm over it. The floats ("ice cream sodas") are fabulous, and the menu is overwhelming. So many options - all the more reason to come back. My husband is not the biggest fan of ice cream but he humors me, and on our last trip he ordered a slice of pecan pie which ended up being the best pecan pie we have had in Phoenix (bested only by a pie we tried on a trip to New Orleans).   As much as I love the floats, the real reason we come is the atmosphere. It feels like you have stepped back in time, or like you have entered The Twilight Zone! especially if you go when the place is empty. Some of the servers really go the extra mile to complete the illusion, fixing their hair in what must be a time-consuming 40's pin-up style. The vibe is so authentic and sort of... creepy (in a good way) it is easy to imagine that it's haunted.   The antiques and vintage art and Knick-knacks certainly add to the vibe, and are quite inexpensive compared to similar stores.

Y_ITj47U4awd4Yr-XG2Kdg.text: Such a cool place.  Best ice cream in town and they have a great kids menu.  Love their tuna salad.  I crave this!    My son loved his grilled cheese and sundae with gummy worms.  They also have a decent selection of nostalgic candy.  He said the best ice cream He's ever had in his life.  The employees are very friendly and accommodating.  This is a place where you take your time.  There's no place like this in town!

Jpxm7S5RZ7FncJ9MiwuRDA.text: By far this is the most authentic real soda fountain in Phoenix!  The pie is exceptional! Omg the Rueben homemade soups are the comfort food I was craving.  The store is such fun!  Don't miss this historical unique restaurant and vintage store.

Nqs7B3pgGXOk0khks28MzA.text: 1929.  That's when one of Phoenix's last remaining soda fountains opened its doors in the same spot that MacAlpine's sits today.  Originally a pharmacy/soda fountain called Birch's, Fred MacAlpine bought the operation in 1938 and made it his own.  Fast forward almost 80 years later, its still here.  While the restaurant is the obvious draw here, MacAlpines is more antique store than anything else.  In fact about three quarters of the MacAlpine's space is dedicated to antique furniture, antique decor, and even an old school clothing boutique.  And they quite literally stack all of their merchandise from floor to ceiling throughout the building.  It's probably a fire marshall's worst nightmare, but I came here on a Friday at lunchtime for the food nostalgia more than anything else.  The restaurant space is squeezed in between the antique sections of the building with sock hop music in the background, neon clocks and signage and (you guessed it) more antiques hanging on the walls and the shelves for your viewing pleasure.  Come on in and seat yourself at the counter or one of a number of booths inside.  There's seating for probably 50-60 inside altogether.  Once seated I was given a menu by the woman who spent almost the entire time whipping up malts and sundaes for the clientele.  The dessert menu here at MacAlpine's (as other have pointed out) is quite expansive.  I was however surprised to see such an expansive non-dessert menu as well.  So choosing your food can take awhile.  I was feeling in a particularly old school mode so I went for a dish that likely wouldn't be on most people's lunch plans, but I channelled my inner Will Ferrell from Wedding Crashers and exclaimed "Mom! Meatloaf!".  Okay I didn't really say that to the waitress, but I did decide on trying their Meatloaf Dinner.  I've had good meatloaf and bad, but when its good, oh man is it ever.  MacAlpine's version comes with mashed potatoes and gravy along with a side of tarragon carrots and a starter side salad.  When it came out, it certainly looked like I'd hoped.  The taste?  Not so much.  The meat was pretty tender and juicy so I can't complain on that front, but I would've liked the vegetables (particularly the celery and onion) to be cooked down more.  I like the meat to standout on dishes like this, but the crunch and somewhat briny taste of the veggies took away from the dish in my opinion.  The carrots and potatoes were fine, but the gravy was a little runny for my liking.  All in all, not that impressed.  Now for dessert, the choices are almost overwhelming.  Malts, sundaes, ice cream sodas, floats, shakes...what's a guy to do?  Well, I did say I was feeling nostalgic, didn't I?  So you can imagine what happened when my eyes fixed on a sundae called the Wallace & Ladmo.  For anyone born before the mid 80s, there were few things Phoenix area kids wanted more than to get their hands on a Ladmo bag on the Wallace & Ladmo variety show.  Sadly, I never did, but I'll happily settle for MacAlpine's tribute to my childhood.  The specs:  a scoop of mint chocolate ice cream, a scoop of chocolate malt crunch ice cream, and a scoop of cookies n' cream ice cream, topped with hot fudge, whipped cream, sprinkles, chopped nuts, and of course the obligatory cherry on top.  I didn't fully appreciate how big this was until it was put in front of me.  Yeah, not meant for just one person.  That said, every bite was delicious and out of sheer stubbornness I did in fact finish it.  Total cost for the food, tax, and tip came to about $25.  For the amount of food I got it, that's a pretty fair price, but like I said the quality of the non-dessert food was underwhelming.  And unfortunately the staff seemed a bit disorganized as I witnessed the staff up front get a number of people's orders mixed up or just plain incorrect.  I didn't experience this myself but my meatloaf did take awhile.  So perhaps skip the lunch and dinner here.  But by all means come for the desserts, come for the nostalgia and the volumes of antiques, and even come for the history.  I mean, how many 88 year old soda fountains do you know of anyway?

YJCwkK4_aY5qMn0r1zw_FQ.text: Another place on my wish list to visit. After reading other reviews I have been hesitant to visit but now glad I did. The interior is very interesting and worth a visit to see the counter, booths, and antiques everywhere. The ice cream soda combinations are phenomenal and we both enjoyed what we ordered. I loved my German chocolate cake soda and hubby went with the Irish eyes are smiling. YUMMY! He went with the Bogart/ a roast beef sandwich with a side of potato salad. I had the "toasted" cheese sandwich with a side of potato salad. Both were equally good and for dessert, we could not resist taking it a step further with homemade apple pie ala mode. So many vintage things to look at as they have a Vintage clothing and retro store attached! Go for ice cream sodas! Go for a small meal. Go for the history and go shopping for something funky for your home or office. I think it would be a great place to take out of town guests to. Only a few booths are available so time your visit or sit at the counter. But keep this place open for its nostalgia and contribution to our area.

79ECIgsBHBju5A7m6K7SVA.text: Historic, yes. Worth the visit, no.  Problem 1: Hosting a political event without warning during the Saturday lunch hour.  No signs on the outside, no warning until we're in and heading for the table, and we realize, "There's a guy, stumping for Mayor of Phoenix, and he's going to just talk the entire lunch hour."  So this means we can either enjoy conversation with our friends or we can sit and eat quietly while an unelected politician tells us why we shouldn't trust elected politicians.  Problem 2: Very dry chicken.  Seriously, I think they stuck a frozen Wal-Mart chicken breast in the microwave and nuked it for 8 minutes or something.  How hard is it to make a chicken sandwich taste good?  So now I get to try to choke down dry chicken and terrible political speeches at the same time.  Problem 3:  The candidate finally quits talking.  Then he takes a photo standing between the waitresses and says, "It's like beauty on the outside, and beast on the inside."  No one laughs.  But then the owner comes up to our table as we're finally getting the chance to talk to each other, and she spends another 15 minutes telling us why we should vote for a certain party and why she wants to move into Phoenix from her home in Fountain Hills.  My favorite line: "We need to make it harder for folks to drive so that they start using public transportation."  But of course, she's not using the light rail on her way in from Fountain Hills.  She just wants the people off her streets when she's trying to drive in and out of the city.  The only good thing about the whole trip--apart from our friends, who are awesome--was that the waitresses were professional and competent.  They earned a good tip and they treated us well.

He3tRgK0UdvnQfNgi-HQTw.text: The food here is good to average, but if you're coming here expecting former then you're just being silly. I would say expect your typical dinner fare; however, they do have a few vegetarian options. The sodas and ice cream sodas are of course the main attraction. The butter beer...OMG delicious! Exactly how I would've imagined it to taste when reading the books. In other words, to die for! Have had the Snow White one as well, which is good, but no comparison to the butter beer.

_cRWfH79QHpbOlufMKlPxQ.text: My family and I decided to try MacAlpine's out the night of my birthday. I had a groupon and had heard some really great things from several different friends. I wasn't disappointed with the atmosphere of the place. Quaint, clean and tastefully covered in antiques and collectibles, it takes you back to a slower, simpler time. I loved the fact that you could purchase most of the charming pieces and for what seemed like a really decent price!  Now about the food. It was alright, but everything tasted fairly bland. (Maybe just an off night. I don't know.) I tried the potato salad that people on yelp rave about and didn't think it was anything to die for. Your only choices are a few sandwiches, hot dogs and a burger which I felt we might have appreciated more for a light lunch than for dinner.  The dessert was yummy and HUGE and since it was a birthday occasion, it was free! We ordered a two scoop sundae that was more than enough for two people. Their soda menu is really impressive and not for the faint of heart. They have lots of yummy combos if you like sodas and ice cream together. I've never been a fan of mixing these things (they are perfectly wonderful all by themselves!) but seriously, if you enjoy floats, this is the place for you!  Customer service, ambiance and dessert were all pretty good, earning this sweet historic gem 3 stars.

37-0TkkEW2TRxxgWexFt7A.text: Good food, cute atmosphere, but server ruined it for us. He had curly hair and was wearing a bow tie- did not listen to what we ordered, didn't bring water until our food was ready (it was hot outside!), and got us some lemons we had asked for twice just before we left to pay. It wasn't busy. Come on.

qNnbXjU3wQI31eF52eivaQ.text: The decor and ambiance is just perfectly retro at MacAlpine's.  From the awesome vintage soda fountain to the waitresses appropriately styled, I love the nostalgic vibe here. My favorite meal here would have to be the veggie burger with a carrot raisin salad as the side and whatever delicious shake I decide to gorge myself on for the day. My last shake there a couple days ago was the red velvet cake shake....It is the most wonderful liquid concoction I have had there yet! They are currently having an amazing sale on vintage items too! I scored a cute grey handbag for less than $10!!

hzqoKCwef5znRqWyjEwRow.text: This is a pretty good old time soda shop. They have to many combonations of soda to count. The ice cream sodas are mouthwatering good.  They're food is pretty tasty as well. The nice thing too is they do not fry anything in the kitchen. Since the restaurant is also in thrift store you can browse while you wait for your food. This would be a great place to take your family especially kids. I always enjoy going to this place and would recommend it to anyone.

VLkTtD9oOjlTC4WTejEFkA.text: This diner, established in 1928, claims to be one of the oldest in Phoenix so it was our first stop upon arrival.  For two Londoners in America this diner was EXACTLY what we wanted from our American road trip.  The waitresses looked great with their vintage uniforms and cool hairstyles, and they were so friendly and helpful.  There was a lovely relaxed vibe, an old-style jukebox, a soda fountain from which you could have any number of tasty concoctions, and great menu selection.  There's even a little vintage shop tacked onto the side which you have to pass through to use the rest rooms...I loved it!  This place is perfect for tourists although we did meet a couple of friendly locals keen to hear about our road trip so far, and at least you know you're getting the real-deal in an original diner rather than a tacky imitation or chain restaurant.

Oo73js2D-nIei4xRHNRGlw.text: Such a quaint and lovely soda shop and restaurant! Really enjoyed the history of the place. There's tons of soda and ice cream options, which is what drew me in to begin with. We had the Bettie Page and Butter Beer! The adjoining antique store is really nice as well. Staff was attentive. Overall environment and atmosphere was unique and pleasant. Going back soon for more ice cream soda!

WgNGMkKThOweb8vcAs0bzQ.text: MacAlpines, where do I start?  From what I can tell from my days of watching Happy Days, it's just like a 1950's diner.  Their sundaes are absolutely D-lish.  They also sell vintage kitsch like furniture, jewelry, hats.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Holy yum!

ZYZ3aPS-WFCOGaJOpl9NGA.text: Walking in at 11:00 on a Friday morning, we were the first ones in, and were greeted right away. Our small group likes the intimacy of booths, and MacAlpine's doesn't disappoint with their tall booths (with integrated coat racks... for Phoenix!).  Lots of nostalgia everywhere, including the adjacent shops with "antique" items from years past.  You can just tell that many of the decorations are original, and the soda fountain is definitely authentic, as well.  We ate light that day - chicken salad sandwich w/ potato salad for me, Malibu chicken and BLT w/ soup for my companions.  We were served quickly, the bread and produce was fresh, and the iced tea was brewed, not from the fountain (yay!). It's standard lunch fare here, nothing fancy, but the kitchen moves the orders out and the staff is always watchful for empty glasses.  The '50's period wear for the servers is fun, but it's their attitude that makes the difference.  Great place for kids!  What's truly remarkable about this place is the assortment of distracting items from your childhood that forgot even existed, from the candy cigarettes for sale at the front, to the household items you see through glass in the adjacent antique shops. It's fun to have exposure to contraptions you don't see in the stores anymore, and that's why this place is a destination.

EnxrCvnOWLNBSEa3Bwcdtw.text: There are so many delicious float options!  The staff is friendly and I definitely felt like I went back in time. I didn't try any food so can't say much about that, but the float was awesome with extra soda and lots of ice cream. Cute antique store attached.

Z9NlPzB-umTFsjtp9xUmzg.text: It was daddy and daughter day. So I decided to bring her here since she loves cheeseburgers! We both had a cheeseburger w/potato salad. NOTE: They do not serve fries!!!! Service is a little slow, but we received our order very fast. We both enjoyed our burgers very much! Very juicy, and cooked perfect! I really liked the potato salad, the daughter is very hard to please! She liked the potato's but she had to pick through the rest of the ingredients! She was ecstatic about being able to create her own shake! She ordered a banana and cheesecake shake, she usually only eat part of it and give the rest away! I was lucky enough to at least try it before she consumed the whole thing!!! Very tasty! I had their fresh lemonade, this was probably the best lemonade I have ever had!!! We really enjoyed this place and definitely will bring mama here.

dyxEzvD_VQW1v1F6UibZwQ.text: MacAlpine's is a fun place for lunch, dessert, or just vintage shopping.  The vintage soda fountain/ restaurant is welcoming and authentic.  This place feels like it should belong in an older city; a rare find for Phoenix.  Specialty soda fountain and ice cream items are what to come for; they do these well.  Lunch is acceptable, but not exciting by any means.  I find the food here to be bland and uninspiring, but not terrible.  This place would be well served by a menu redesign.  Nevertheless, I love the atmosphere, and will likely return for the nostalgic factor.

jCpTH8r2Z9u5i8cNkh6NlA.text: In town visiting for another week, and back to MacAlpine's I go! There are several more restaurants or cafes in the area that are good places to go, but MacAlpine's is the one that will keep bringing me back over and over. It's certainly a real taste of nostalgia. In addition to the great food, the real draw is the atmosphere and ambience that you immediately get when you walk in the door. The old soda fountain (in working order), all of the retro furniture, antiques, vintage clothing, and friendly waitresses who dress the part. It's worth the trip if you want to step back in time, take it easy, and enjoy a bit of the past!

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stuffed Tomato Chicken Salad. Yum!

qH-rFB1pMG45_TSoZpfjdg.text: The food was really good and they have an amazing selection of ice cream sodas... Would take weeks to try them all. The reason I am taking off a star is because of the service. Our server was nice but we had to remind her a few times about items we ordered and ended up not getting things we ordered at the beginning until we were done eating, and our server points to some other employees behind her and says "blame them". And then they still forgot a shake. But in general it was a nice place that we'd go to again.

m9-WDofcaBt4Rojgnlgrzg.text: I visited MacAlpine's today with my boyfriend and it was a really great experience. I got the hot pastrami sandwich with potato salad and a cherry lime egg creme. SO! GOOD! He got the chef's special: a bratwurst with sauerkraut and provalone on a toasted bun, and a tiger's blood phosphate--I took a sip of the phosphate and it was so intense and delicious.  We were both really full when we were done and the total for each of us came out to about ten dollars.  The servers were great, but disorganized.  We looked around the antique shop afterward and I bought a skirt for six dollars on sale. There is so much great stuff there--I wanted to take home every couch! And there are awesome time pieces in the two areas full of clothes.  I'm going to tell everyone I know about this place!

VdQ6Nis2I0vnu5qXXSW82Q.text: This place is so neat. Not only is the old time restaurant and soda fountain portion the most authentic I've seen, the vintage store section has really interesting items and the prices are reasonable.   If you're looking for great ice cream in a by-gone era setting -- this is a place not to miss!

3QuJEXYIvSUKW13dDTIT-g.text: This place is cute and quaint. And then you see the thrift shop next door, and it's even more cute and quaint! I really enjoyed the chicken sandwich. I ordered an ice cream soda, the one with mango, but it wasn't anything to write home about (if I wrote home, to begin with).

R6A9Ay3rlSeJes4-ZmDfWw.text: Cute little vintage boutique and retro soda fountain/dining.    The place is kind of curiously arranged, with a vintage store consuming several store fronts and the dining in the middle... so that I had to walk thru the dining area to reach different sections of the shopping.  But that helps to keep this place really laid back and casual.  At the soda bar, I saw several families just hanging out at the counter and sharing a sundae.  It looks to be the perfect local hangout spot. The vintage store is pretty popular as well--with usual mix of curiosity seekers and treasures hunters.   I personally didn't find anything that I would want to take home, but it was nice browsing nonetheless.  I definitely plan to visit again and bring the kids!

7oePXuztQBih_VqJ4gTudg.text: Charming old-fashioned soda fountain just north of downtown Phoenix. Fun atmosphere. Great place to take the family. Try the turtle sundae--outstanding!

8LXw8fF4l99DYVpbbbLVfg.text: Mac Alpine's is an Original Soda Fountain.  Pretty sure it's the only one left in the city.  When you walk in you can sit on one of the stools at the original bar and one of the lovely folks there will make the drink or ice cream desert of your dream.  A fizz, an egg cream, a malt or even a simple Dr Pepper float.  You name it, they can make it.  The ice cream deserts rock in their simplicity.    There are some very cool original booths still left, and some extra seating in the back.  It's not a huge place by any means, but I've never had to wait for a table - even when they were a stop on the First Friday bus route.  Folks who came by acted like they were in a museum - just looking at all the cool stuff - some of which is for sale - and left.  They have NO idea what they were missing out on here.    The ONLY thing that makes the place not get 5 stars is that they don't offer french fries.  Their burgers are awesome - but without the fries, I stick more to their amazing BLT or their messy but good good egg salad.  Both of those go great with their potato salad - which I think is one of the best ever.    The absolute best part?  We had 2 meals, 2 flavored drinks and 2 deserts and it cost less than $25.  Bam baby.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They usually have some cool &#34;back in the day&#34; candy up front for your impulse purchasing needs.
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not the best shot, but this is facing the door and you can see a bit of the booths.
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5ErxdC0kL48XQBkRngUOSw.text: MacAlpine's Soda Fountain is all right be me....  It's a cool place to meet up with some friends for an ice cream treat, soda or float.  The food is OK, not great but not bad either.  The service can be a hit and miss depending on who you get as a server and when you go.  The ice cream and soda treats are fantastic!  The ambiance ~ the soda bar is cool and there are two side rooms full of antiques that are for sale everywhere.    I've had their Reuben which was A-OK and on my last trip I sampled their burger and chips with chocolate shank which was shank-a-licious!!   My burger was cooked well, but nothing fancy.  I also had a small salad which was nice but not memorable.  My shake was really good and left an indelible impression on my taste buds.   Side note: "Give the dude out front holding the sign "We are open for Lunch" a break and let him come inside where it's a little cooler.  Use a curbside sign instead.  If you're a germ-o-phobe, like me that doesn't like dirty old things hanging everywhere especially where you are eating, you need to get past that and give MacAlpine's Soda Fountain a try.

WuHyBUzlRIPCQAdzoE3bGw.text: This place is a callback to days gone by. It is also one of the only places open for a late lunch in this area. They have great cold sandwiches, piled high with meat. Their split pea soup is some of the best I've had in a long time. The servers in their cute little uniforms are good too. Plus, you can't really beat the prices.   Plus, they have all the old-timey soda fountain creations. I got a chocolate phosphate! A chocolate phosphate! Yum. My only complaint is that it was a little low on the chocolate.   In addition to food, this place has a large vintage type shop. We didn't really peruse the shop much, but it looked like they have a bunch of great stuff at good prices. Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z4JDHz_IN_zqv_LMvz8TOA.text: This is a great place. If you enjoy actual soda fountains, this place will make you feel like you stepped back in time. Mostly because, their furnishings remain unchanged. And, they even have a whole vintage shop inside, right when you walk in. It's a cool trip down memory lane, even if you're young. Up until recently, I wasn't aware of all the different vegetarian items they have. That's important to me, and so that was a cool surprise. The staff is sometimes coolly detached, but that's not a bad thing. Anything the spot "lacks" is compensated for with the employees' FUN HUMOR and great customer service. If you need a recommendation... just ask. It's worth it. Don't go with "regular" here... try some of their "non-traditional" items. I'm not sure how many of these dishes are from the soda fountain era. BUT... the flavors are always great. (They have funny names for most of the items.) Kids would love this place. Last thing, the management is reasonable. So if you need something, or are curious about something, ask them. They love talking about their business.

PhHr4pfHPdvVnfZjWJKq0w.text: I think the 83 reviewers ahead of me did a more than adequate job of profiling the food experience you get at this old-fashioned soda fountain.    What many patrons do not know is that the owners purchased this business shortly before 9/11 and were advised by friends to unload it because it did not have potential for an ROI.  They ignored the advice, poured their heart and soul into it, and are a huge reason why there are 83 reviews sitting here for your perusal.  Their fortitude is a gift for which Phoenix should be grateful.  These guys absolutely knocked themselves out for our event!  And it didn't matter that it was August and the A/C was not made to accommodate the crowd we brought in.  People stayed, ate, shopped the vintage store, and had a great time.  I still have the candy cigarettes Monica gave me as a party favor, and I smile every time they catch my eye on the kitchen counter.  She epitomizes the mantra, "Do what you love, love what you do,"  You can't help but enjoy a visit into the local time machine AKA MacAlpine's Soda Fountain.

2ugUimozlF9r_OoO5Q0nrQ.text: I live close to this place but have never given them a shot. A friend and I had planned a lunch but had not committed to a location. He picked me up and as we headed up 7th street we drove by this place... I suggested we give it a try and so we did. The atmosphere was a welcomed trip back in time. A little soda shop indeed, surrounded by treasures from the past. The staff was pleasant for the most part. I ordered a BLT with potato salad (just like my mother use to make!) The price was a bit more than I would normally pay for a sandwich but I think the experience was worth it.

g6eO6kLLfdpvPC9CxsNcCg.text: I took my daughter there for lunch, thought it would be a fun place to take her. She got a hot dog and didn't like it. I didn't taste it but I don't blame her. It was one huge sausage that was overly cooked and looked dry and unappealing. The waitress noticed she didn't take more than one bite and we ordered a pb&j and the hot dog was taken off of the bill. They only have soda and as my 6 year old doesn't drink it she ordered a lemonade because they don't have juice, not a big deal. I ordered a root beer float, haven't had one in years! It was pretty tasty. I also had the club and it was really good. Overall the service was good, my meal was good. FYI- the juke boxes on the tables will take your change but won't play any songs ;)

ZQqOSLYHTWZHCZd5I8YsWQ.text: Super cute, and eclectic.  I loved the vibe of the place from the minute I walked in.  We had a shake and wondered around, but I can't attest to anything else.  All of the servers were nice and helpful and the shake was super yummy.

C-cp6R4x9oTEOpy76lSfjw.text: Becoming our favorite place. The ice cream is "awesome" according to our kids! A must visit

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

n-E1HiNx81LQIQ2MRiaIZw.text: My husband and I went here on a recommendation from someone so we were looking forward to it.  The place is easy enough to find but once you get there don't pass the blue door.  You hardly know it's a restaurant because of all the antiques.  Once inside it is a very quaint place which has a lot of memorabilia in it and tons of antiques if that's your thing.  A little too dusty for my liking.  The food is what we went for but I was disappointed. My husband had a cheeseburger which he said was good but not the best he ever had.  There are some sides offered like potato salad for example which was tasty.  I had the "Bird", which was a turkey burger.  First off it is a frozen tasteless pre-made patty.  No seasoning at all and it had the "I've been in the freezer way too long" taste.  I hate that taste.  Nothing worse than freezer burnt meat. I added salt and pepper and mustard to try and hide that "taste" but it wasn't happening.  Don't order the turkey burger because you will be disappointed.  I had a sparkly lemonade with no spark.  Very flat.  My husband had a chocolate malt.  Again he said it was good but not the best he ever had.  And it was definitely not worth the 6 buck price tag!  Service was ok.  We won't be going back.  It was a nice visit but I wouldn't want to live there!

iEVrNK3HcTZ3R77xBZuRZA.text: Here's a sample experience at MacAlpines:  Wow! A real, old fashioned soda parlor! Whoa, look at all this vintage stuff! Hey, check out the menu! Oh hell yeah I love this kind of candy, I haven't seen this in forever! Oh maaan 99 flavors of soda what the whaaat!   Mmm.. pina colada soda, wait, the butter pecan is even better! No, taste the margarita! Wait, they're refillable! AHHH!!!! VANILLA COKE! BUBBLEGUM! MORE BUTTER PECAN! HEY THERE'S CHOCOLATE! GIVE ME AN IRISH CREAM FLAVOR! PUT CARAMEL IN IT! ANOTHER CARAMEL, THIS TIME WITH CHOCOLATE! WE HAVEN'T EVEN TRIED THE ICE CREAM, WE NEED THIS ONE WITH ICE CREAM IN IT. MORE ICE CREAM YUM THRIFTY ICE CREAM!!!!!!!  Holy shiznit, that soda.... 'twas nothing but awesome... I don't feel so good.  *passes out in the car*  Arrives home.  *passes out for fifteen hours*  Awakens with a hangover more vicious than the Thursday following Wine Wednesdays at ASU. Remembers MacAlpines fondly while taking 3 Ibuprofen. Goes back to sleep.

zlznVzyGuxZDo4mGpa37MA.text: Don't go for the food.  But my husband disagrees.  GO FOR THE AMAZING ICE CREAMS AND SODAS. He does agree with that!  it even smells antiquey in there.

QAEgs5-VFfCQBFDOF4bQbg.text: Some places are old because they are cool. MacAlpine's is cool because it is old.  It smells like your Grandmother's house (some people find this endearing. Really? Musty is chic now?). Food is extra medium. We went with a group of a dozen (none of whom had been there) and no one raved about their entree.  I'm docking a star for having a broken air conditioner (during the hottest week in Phoenix August history) --- our shakes & ice creams went melty fast. Also... they close at 7. Just because it smells like my Grandmother's house doesn't mean it should go to bed when she does.  Stars for great service, lots of things to look at and a bajillion choices of Italian sodas. Plus it's old. 1928 in Phoenix is like 1700 in Boston.  Worth a visit to say you have been there... and if you want a soda fountain, a Coronado alternative to the Sugar Bowl.

7xRZYhfsvnRdhoe-gp58Ew.text: Great ambiance. Overall good look. Customer service could use some help. Great selection of ice cream. Food was decent but not a highlight.

QcsY86Ni32GipkEJEaaUPg.text: We had great service, enjoyed the custom made old tyme soda fountain drinks and ice cream. Looking at the antique store connected to the restaurant was fun.  Why 2 star?  The food.  It was dreadful.  They are not even trying to make it good.  I would forgive them if they made an effort, but based on all of the other negative comments about the food you would think they might try to step it up a notch.  They have been in business forever and good for them.  If you go, go for the atmosphere, go for the soda fountain, skip the food.

_eKK8nZw28WdoIWxuYXmKA.text: After arriving in Phoenix, my wife and I had to get a burger at Five Guys.  We then were craving some good ice cream.  Checked out Yelp and the reviews definitely didn't disappoint.  This place is awesome.  Great atmosphere and fun environment.  The ice cream was out of this world.  Would recommend to anyone coming to Phoenix to check this place out.  Would give it 6 STARS if I could.

x08At0Quj0_VbU3OzsqS1A.text: Stopped in for some shakes and treats since we heard they have the best shakes in Phoenix! It's cozy and cute with lots of stuff to look at. Our desserts were good but I though the kids menu desserts were pretty large to be from the kids menu. Got our check and seen that the "kids" desserts were so large because the server rang in adult sundaes instead of kids. When my husband asked her about it she was rude and said she did us a favor by charging us for one scoop and giving us two. We told her that we ordered the kids size which was suppose to be much cheaper but she argues that she rang it up as an adult one because it's a better deal. ($3 more than the kids one). We just paid and left as it wasn't worth arguing over but we will not be back to a place that just charges you whatever they feel like to get more money. Felt like we were getting ripped off a little. It's a shame that the server ruined our experience.

_sSCWdf7Ay8Zu54wza4-GQ.text: I can understand how this location can get some extra points for being quaint  but it will certainly not get points for being clean.  The soda I had was great but I could not get over how dirty and run down this place was.  The staff where inattentive and to be honest completely useless, the tile on the floor was pealing off, the bar looked very warn and the booth we sat in was sticky. I understand the concept but I cannot forgive dirt when I visited a location.   I won't be back again.

pOAYIYI1e6wkfwfDu1pssQ.text: I met a friend for lunch and she took us to MacAlpine's as she lives in the neighborhood just behind it. When you first walk in, it smells like your Grandma's closet as the diner sits between two sides of their vintage/antique wares. But for those of us that like vintage junk/treasures, it was a neat atmosphere. It's like finding a little gold mine somewhere you don't expect it.   "I LOVE HER HAIR" was the first thing I said as we entered the diner. The waitresses looked super cute in their outfits and pinup style hair. I didn't get her name but one had beautiful black hair with the biggest victory rolls and it looks amazing. So at this point, I'm already pleased. The food probably could have been bad, and I would have still liked the place.   We were passed the drinks/sodas/shakes/malt menu and it was extensive. As a Scentsy rep, my friend was like...."It's just like Scentsy, so many to choose from!" I decided on a blackberry shake as I use to get them as a girl back home in Washington. It was YUMMY!  We both ordered the Pastrami Reuben for lunch on sourdough rather than rye and had the potato salad as a side. The potato salad was divine. Great flavor, consistency, and appeal. The sandwich was good too. Nothing super fabulous but a good standard Reuben.  We chatted, admired the stuff all over the walls, and strolled around the store afterwards looking at stuff.   I throughly enjoyed my trip to MacAlpine's and will be going back with my daughter to try the dill pickle shake as she's obsessed with pickles!

GAg20aNtzhK47wNAE2f-AA.text: Had the hot lunch special, a BBQ pork sandwich, and potato salad.  The sandwich was tasty, but average.  The potato salad was a bit bland.  I love MacAlpine's atmosphere, however, so I will definitely return.

ozdeHD1uXBDjHYTX0_2e4A.text: I wanted to love this place, but was quite disappointed. I only hope the owners /management recognize the problems and are able to do this establishment justice. We visited for lunch with older native Phoenix family members. Hoping to enjoy a trip down memory lane. Unfortunately, the poor quality food overshadowed the nostalgia. Seven of us ordered lunch. We had heard the burgers were excellent. They are not. Honestly, I've had better fast food burgers - and I don't care for fast food. The patty actually tasted like it was pulled from the freezer and thrown on the flattop. The side of potato salad was passable.   The pulled pork sandwich was unremarkable.   The stuffed tomato was unimpressive. The BLT was just okay.   On the other hand, the club with added avocado was tasty.   We might consider returning for dessert only, but it won't be our first choice.   The grasshopper sundae was tasty, but there were ice chunks in the ice cream.   A note on the service: it was a bit slow, despite us feeling rushed in the beginning. More noticeable (and annoying) was the phony, "customer service " voice our waitress used. There was no detectable authenticity.   Also, although an 18% gratuity was added to our party of seven, the cashier asked if we wanted to leave an additional tip. That created an uncomfortable moment because the service didn't even merit the 18%.

b9jRgaZar6hMUc3HBgqHVg.text: Super fun place to walk around in and have some yummy ice cream. My one complaint would be the servers. Both were kida rude and annoyed at the customers. Our orders were all wrong (we got 5 diff sundaes), and the ones the waitress recommended was so not tasty (could just be a taste preference thing though). Would DEF come back if the staff was changed. Maybe its the silly uniforms they have to wear, but those blonde girls were not happy NOR friendly...

xmiUclaY7AqIc6OyV079aQ.text: Cute vintage/retro shop with a diner/soda fountain inside. Ordered 1 malt and 1 milkshake. For $15 and change, I expected extraordinary. What we got was just ordinary. Nothing special and just a standard sized beverage.

0HvgFm3s11JcRnN7H1MajQ.text: Amazing nostalgia and history here in Phoenix.  They have done a wonderful job curating some vintage shopping as well as an extremely tasty menu!  This place is as close to real magic as you can get and genuinely feels like being transported back to another time where things were simpler.  Wonderful friendly staff and great location.  This is a 1000% must visit in Phoenix.

tdK4APP6GzmKguG1Anwryw.text: MacAlpines Diner was a surprise to me.  We went with cousins to which they knew how much I loved antique items as I managed a thrift store for 3 years.... They did tell me it was a diner with antiques which you could purchase from... I just didn't realize how big it was and how amazing the prices were....   The restaurant was an old fashioned soda pop type of restaurant... everything there was like it would have been back in the 50's... for lunch I had the Reuben & my cousin had the Malibu Chicken Sandwich and others had pulled-pork sandwich (not pictured) & grilled cheese & tomato sandwich (not pictured).... plus dessert.... OMG!!!!!  We were extremely full  Then they had antiques everywhere to which could be purchased....   If you want something unique, check this place out as I think it's a must... definitely will be going back and bringing friends with me.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TvHzieQiAUtdjE6u--xiLA.text: So cool and Nostalgic! This is a must see as a local or someone traveling through as a tourist thing bahaha! Plenty of parking and I personally loved sitting at the original Soda Shop set up with all that hard rock  gum underneath! I ordered a banana with peanut butter shake and it was out of this world yummy! I don't eat ice cream often but I was in heaven and gulped it down faster then ever! I also enjoyed shopping through the store and seeing old items from even my childhood as I waited for them to make my ice cream.  Very cool spot keep it forever Phoenix!

qV23K-O9b4ZxpBtPDjW_Dg.text: Waaaaaaaaay overpriced for what you get.  The atmosphere is cute until you realize it's just really cluttered and it doesn't feel cute anymore.  It's also incredibly stuffy and warm in there.  I enjoyed what I ate but can't see myself coming back

CXJjthIWoLE2wV5EjxWAhQ.text: The soda fountain and the antiques initially drew me to visit.  I was pleasantly surprised by their food too.  I ordered the Mac Clubhouse Sandwich and it was yummy!  Included an I Dream of Jennie dreamsicle float which was just that dreamy and delicious.  Next time I'll be trying the Pineapple Upside-Down Cake.    I initially thought it would be dusty from the antiques but it was not.  I was impressed at how clean it was.  Friendly reminder this is a 30's nostalgic restaurant and shop, so don't expect new anything, including the tables and chairs.  The white tables and chairs are a bit flimsy so sit in a booth if you need more stability.  Don't pass up the friendly staff and spend some time looking at the clothes, it's like a treasure chest in there!  You have tons of modern choices, give this a shot, you'll be glad you did.

A517q54WXwLhOeIkK1vlXw.text: What's better then a banana split? Having a banana split at an antique store! The service was great the whole crew is super friendly and makes you feel right at home. The whole store has so much to offer so if you go in for ice cream you'll more then likely leave with a new purchase as well!

F5wBn6bUmFWnvYwVGev1MA.text: We love coming here for family fun, nostalgia and a little treat. The staff is super friendly, it is fun checking out the antiques and the treats are sweet!

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butterbeer float

npAztBhE1rUSLtla0zBy_g.text: Best Pecan Pie You'll EVER Have! If you are near here you have no excuse. Pies are made from scratch here (even the crust!) and the floats & sodas are authentic. This place has been around for almost 100 years! It's like sitting in a museum. The service is wonderful too! These people are proud of their jobs here and it shows. Surrounding this soda shoppe are antiques galore so if you're not hungry yet when you arrive, look at the cool stuff everywhere and work yourself an appetite!

UujQufbsMadniTMkA3MCNQ.text: Talk about a throwback Thursday, flashback Friday, blast from the past or whatever you call it. Gun it to 88 and go back in time to this classic American soda shop. Tons of old memorabilia adorns the wall along with a variety of antiques and odds and ends for sale that you see on an episode of American Pickers. Came in after a Saturday event downtown for some ice cream. They have a wide variety of flavors to choose from and milkshakes and malts too. Your classic diner style food from cold sandwiches to hamburgers, pb&j, and pies as well. Awesome little place so come on in if you're in the area for a quick bite to eat and a good old fashioned milkshake.

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

W-EV5jYKTi0Gj8qRS3ar_w.text: Such a beautiful shop and restaurant. I'd imagine it's great for photo shoots. However, I wouldn't consider this a thrift store as it is not thrifty whatsoever. It's more so an antique/second-hand shop. For me, the beat part of buying second-hand is finding cheap vintage stuff. Here, it feels like I'm shopping on Etsy after the shop owner has hiked up the price by over 50 percent of what they paid. Definitely worth a visit, but you have to be willing to pay more than what you'd pay for something new. Just because something is old doesn't mean it should be priced as though it is rare!

fQCvO4bJZkE1SWMmoCpYbQ.text: I'm hearing disabled and was questioning why the children's menu was more expensive than the adult menu for ice cream sundaes. The owner was so rude and disrespectful to me. I almost cried. She finally yelled at me that they need to redo the menu. So make sure you are aware that the children's menu is more expensive than the adult menu, it just has a much smaller portion for more cost.

mQD-IdwR5ADJrKlVrwWk7w.text: This place is such a wonderful throwback to my younger years. I love I cream sodas and theirs are the best.  They are big, tasty and full of ice cream.  Lots of everything that is yummy.   The shop has antiques to sell as well.  Anyone that remembers the old school saddle shoes can buy them new there. I did for my little granddaughter along with some beautiful red ruby heels.  The employees are sweet just like what they sell. It's a great place to visit.  If your looking for something different take a peek at this charming place. You won't regret it!

qeoZeTEVGwAAbx1ifTn2TQ.text: A complete blast from the past, all the way down to staff uniforms, the traditional soda fountain counter, the booths, the menu, and even the jukebox. Must visit - you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of MacAlpine's Diner & Soda Fountain - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dcfZzeZF1EDjHjbHfpBzVQ.text: This place is a treasure. I've stopped through occasionally for a sweet treat or just to browse the antiques. The vintage soda fountain is full service and makes a mean chocolate malt. I also recommend the salted caramel pecan pie. Yes, please! The rest of the store is fun, a great place to find a unique gift or piece for yourself. So happy I stumbled across this little gem.

ooPElp6NCasQWOAkUeBEdg.text: Yummy, goodies straight from heaven. Plus lots of cool unusual finds. Love the old fashion feel of the ice cream shop. Great customer service and pies!

oXwLeYkg5TEpsLwWaJ-Rug.text: Straight up, this place was far from my first choice. Generally, I look for the new and flashy place or something with exotic sounding food to try something different. I am entirely thrilled that my wife found and suggested this place. The food is on point, the portions are as they should be. Fresh ingrediants coupled with quality cooking and amazing staff, you cannot go wrong here. Everything tasted amazing and my kids killed their dishes.   We will be back

Sy0mfWtD0igijWe6hbMRfQ.text: Such a cute restaurant. I can't speak for the food, but the Yin and Yang Sundae I had was SO GOOD. And there was so much of it!! I can't wait to come back with more of an appetite to try the food! The antique/vintage store they have is cute as well! The staff is very friendly. Definitely a must see if you're in Phoenix.
